loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es una persona encantadora y muy dinámica de 31 años de edad, madre de dos menores, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza , ropa y accesorios, ella ofrece sus productos  en el mercado informal de Bellavista, cuenta con el apoyo de se esposo  que trabaja en una empresa de gas. Es integrante del Banco Comunal “Siete Estrellas” desde hace dos años.
El primer préstamo que obtuvo fue de 300 soles lo invirtió en la compra de néctar y gaseosas, negocio que tenía antes. Actualemnte se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, ropa y accesorios por catálogo, para lo cual requiere un préstamo de 1800 soles.
texts.en:
Luz is a charming and dynamic person. She is 31 years old, mother of two young children, and works in the sales of beauty products, clothing and accessories. She offers her products in the informal market at Bellavista. She has the support of her husband who works at a gas company. She has been a member of the Communal Bank “Siete Estrellas” for two years.

The first loan that she obtained was for 300 Soles ($100 USD) that she invested in the purchase of juices and sodas for her former business. Now she works in the sales of beauty products, clothes, and accessories by catalog, for which she needs a loan of 1,800 Soles.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products, lotions, creams, etc...

loans.name: Idalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Idalia del Carmen R. C. es una señora de 39 años de edad quien vive con su esposo y sus cinco hijos.

La comunidad donde vive doña Idalia se llama Canalete localizada en Upala en la provincia de Alajuela, es un lugar semimontañoso y sus actividades económicas se centran en la agricultura y mayormente en la ganadería. Es una comunidad con oportunidad de desarrollo y establecimiento de microempresas, tanto de agroindustria como  comercio.

Desde hace 5 años que doña Idalia inició un negocio de costura y confección de ropa. Ella remienda y elabora diferentes tipos de prendas de vestir que luego vende en negocios de la comunidad y sus alrededores e incluso la llegan a buscar a su casa. Su microempresa ha ayudado a que la condición de vida de su familia haya mejorado considerablemente. Dice que el poder brindar un buen servicio a las personas y cumplir con sus exigencias, son la base del éxito del negocio.

Actualmente doña Idalia requiere un préstamo de ¢680,000 (seiscientos mil colones) para comprar una máquina especial para coser y materiales como telas, hilos, etc. Con esta inversión espera poder incrementar su producción y mejorar la calidad de los  productos. Afirma que gracias a este préstamo podrá atraer a más clientes, ofrecer mejores alternativas y mejorar considerablemente la calidad de sus productos.

Doña Idalia es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer crédito y con el espera seguir creciendo personal y profesionalmente.

loans.use: Compra de una máquina de coser, telas, hilos, entre otros materiales

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer activa y colaboradora, tiene 55 años D. edad, madre D. seis hijos todos mayores D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza, y prendas D. vestir, ella trabaja junto a sus hijas, sus productos los ofrece en el mercado informal D. Bellavista donD. da crédito y cobra diariamente. Es socia desD. hace seis años del Banco Comunal “Siete Estrellas”, el primer préstamo que recibió fue D. 300 soles que invirtió en productos D. belleza.
Con este préstamo es D. S/ 3,000 soles le permitirá viajar a la ciudad D. Lima para traer mercadería tales como prendas D. vestir, juego D. sábanas, edredones. La meta D. Juanita es construir un local  donD. pueda vender todos sus productos.
texts.en:
Juana is an active and cooperative person. She is 55 years old, mother of six children, and works in the sales of beauty products and garments. She has been working asiD. her daughters. She sells her products in the informal market at Bellavista, where she sells on credit and daily payments. She has been a member of the Communal Bank “Siete Estrellas” for six years. The first loan that she received was for 300 soles ($100 USD), which she invested in the purchase of beauty products.

With this loan of 3,000 Soles, she will be able to travel to the city of Lima to bring merchandise such as garments, sheet sets and comforters. Her goal is to construct a shop where she can sell all her products.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in merchandise such as garments, sheet sets and comforters

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, el señor Francisco M. tiene su propio negocio de reparación de accesorios electrónicos tales como radios, televisores, dvd, teléfonos, entre otros.

 A esta actividad se dedica desde hace 15 años y ha sido un excelente trabajador que ha logrado suplir las necesidades de su hogar. Hoy en día el señor Francisco espera ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita la compra de los accesorios electrónicos para llevar el trabajo de manera más eficiente y así brindar un buen servicio a todos y cada uno de sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the Department of León, Francisco M. operates his own repair business for electronic devices such as radios, televisions, DVD players, and telephones, among others. He has worked in this field for 15 years, and he has been an excellent worker who has been able to cover the needs of his household. Today, Francisco hopes to be granted a loan for the purchase of electronic accessories, which will allow him to carry out his work more efficiently and thus provide outstanding service to all of his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of electronic accessories

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy es una persona emprendedora y muy alegre, tiene 54 años de edad, madre de cuatro hijos mayores de edad, todos independientes, se dedica a la decoración de ambientes para todo tipo de agasajos, ella trabaja junto a su hermana en esta actividad donde ambas son socias y se esfuerzan para ser cada día mejor su trabajo prueba de ello es que sus servicios se han incrementado y requieren de personal para hacer las decoraciones, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al negocio de la madera. Empezó con un préstamo de 300 soles, que invirtió en la compra de infladores de globos, telas, tecnopor. Actualmente requiere un préstamos de 3000 soles, el cual invertira en la compra de sillas, telas, etc. La meta de Nancy es comprar vitrinas para exhibir sus productos y tener un local propio para su negocio de decoración bien implementado.
texts.en:
Nancy is an enterprising and very happy person. She is 54, and she has four grown and independent children. She decorates places for all types of parties. She works and her sister work as partners in this activity . They put forth effort so that each day their work is better. The proof of this is that their services have increased, and they need to hire people to make the decorations. She counts on her husband’s support; he is in the wood business. She started with a loan for 300 PEN, which she used to buy balloon inflators, fabric, and Styrofoam. She currently needs a loan for 3,000 PEN, which she will use to buy chairs and fabric, etc. Nancy’s goal is to buy display cases to show her products and to have her own location for a well established decorating business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chairs and fabric, etc.

loans.name: Patak Pollerita Group

texts.es:
El centro focal de Villa Exaltación esta ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, a este pertenece la asociación “Patak Pollerita”, son diez integrantes  que trabajan con mucha responsabilidad en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas.
La actividad principal de este grupo es la comercialización de ropa, en algunos casos esta mercadería la adquieren de mayoristas para luego venderlas al detalle y también otras de las socias confeccionan prendas, como es el caso de  Flora, ella confecciona buzos deportivos y los vende en la feria de las mañaneras,(calle Tumusla de La ciudad  de La Paz) .Desean ampliar sus ventas, para este objetivo  necesitan comprar materia prima o mercadería en mayor cantidad, con esto obtener mayores ganancias que les permita obtener mejores beneficios y mejora de la calidad de vida  de sus familias.
texts.en:
At the Villa Exaltación center, which is located in the city of El Alto, the "Patak Pollerita" association meets. Its ten members work very responsibly in regards to their payments and internal activities. The main activity of this group is selling clothing. In some cases, they acquire the merchandise wholesale to then sell it retail. Other members make garments, as in the case of Flora. She makes track suits and sells them at an early morning market (on Tumusla street in the city of La Paz). They hope to expand their sales. For this objective, they need to buy supplies or merchandise in greater quantities. In this way, they will obtain larger profits that will allow them to obtain more benefits and improve the quality of life of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies or merchandise

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer trabajadora y muy activa, tiene 39 años y madre de un adolescente, es divorciada, se dedica a la decoración de ambientes para cumpleaños y todo tipo de agasajos, trabaja junto a su hermana en esta actividad, forma parte del Banco Comunal “Siete estrellas” desde hace tres años, el primer préstamo que recibió le permitió invertir en bebidas como gaseosa, refrescos.
Con este préstamo de S/ 1000 soles invertirá en la compra de telas y algunos artículos que utiliza para la decorar. La meta de Sandra es tener un local bien implementado para poder ofrecer sus servicios de decoración y también traer de Lima artículos para regalos.
texts.en:
Sandra is a hard-working, very lively woman of 39. She is divorced and the mother of a teenager. She works decorating places for birthday parties and all types of celebrations. Her sister works with her, and she has been a member of the community bank “Siete estrellas” (Seven Stars) for the past three years. The first loan that she received allowed her to invest in soft drinks, and carbonated beverages. With this loan of 1000 new soles ($350 US), she will purchase fabrics and other articles that she will use for decorating. Her goal is to have a well-stocked business location so that she can offer her decorating services and also bring gift items to sell from Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and articles for decorating.

loans.name: Caminantes Group

texts.es: El grupo “Caminates”  esta representado por la señora María Rosalia y conformado por 12 miembros D. personas cariñosas, dinámicas y trabajadoras, tienen una amistad desD. hace mucho tiempo y sus edades varían desD. 24 hasta 63 años.  Las socias se dedican a la venta D. frutas y lo venden en una feria todos los lunes y las otras señoras venden comida como almuerzo y cena y las otras socias  venden ropa usada para niños. Todas tienen sus puestos en la feria cerca al barrio. Prácticamente las señoras tienen ya su clientes bien selecta y saben que la competencia es granD. y que para combatirla necesitan D. mas mercadería insumos y también agrandar su ambientes D. trabajo es por esta razón que requieren el crédito que lesa ayudara a genera un mayor ingreso para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. Este grupo esta emprendiendo su primer ciclo pero en la reuniones han demostrando ganas D. salir adelante, responsabilidad, honradez y sobre todo unión que es lo esencial en un grupo solidario
texts.en:
The "Caminates" group is represented by señora María Rosalia and has 12 members, who are caring, dynamic, and hard-working people. They have been friends for a long time, and their ages range from 24 to 63 years. The members make a living by selling fruit, which they do at a market every Monday. The other women sell food for lunch and dinner, and still others sell used clothing for children. All of them have their own stands in the market near their neighborhood. The women have their customers well-selected, and they know that the competition is great. To fight it, they need more merchandise and to expand their working environment. This is why they need the credit that will help them generate more income to offer their families a better quality of life. This is the group's first loan, but in their meetings, they have demonstrated their desire to get ahead as well as their responsibility, honesty, and above all, their teamwork, which is essential in a support group.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Los Picaflores Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los picaF.” esta conformado por 14 personas alegres y trabajadoras, tienen una amistad desD. hace mucho tiempo y sus edades varían desD. 19 hasta 63 años.  La presidenta Cristina tiene 2 hijos pequeños los mismos van a la escuela primaria, ella al igual que sus compañeras se dedica a la venta D. productos venta D. carteras, el resto D. los miembros del grupo se dedica a la venta D. verduras, venta D. ropa interior,  venta D. abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, comida y al servicio D. limpieza domestica;  algunos D. sus puestos D. venta son fijos y otras son ambulantes. Sus competidores D. negocios están presentes, pero las señoras tienen clientes fieles que adquieren productos constantemente, en caso D. dificultades en sus negocios, diversifican su actividad comercial para obtener ingresos, algunas D. ellas empiezan a trabajar medio tiempo con un sueldo fijo en actividades D. limpieza D. viviendas y  el otro medio tiempo atienden su negocio. Las socias quieren aprovechar las ofertas D. cosméticos por catálogos adquiriendo más mercadería e insumos para generar un mayor ingreso para poder brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.  Las socias esta emprendiendo su tercer ciclo demostrando ganas D. salir adelante, responsabilidad, honradez y sobre todo unión que es lo esencial en un grupo solidario. Este grupo esta emprendiendo su primer ciclo pero en la reuniones han demostrando ganas D. salir adelante, responsabilidad, honradez y sobre todo unión que es lo esencial en un grupo solidario

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Senac Group

texts.es: El grupo “Senac” representado por la señora Ruth Mery y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales se dedican a la venta D. ropa en forma ambulante, venta D. golosinas en porterías D. escuelas, venta D. desayuno, comida, servicio D. radio difusión, agricultura y servicio D. taxi. Como en toda actividad existe competencia, pero las señoras ponen todo D. su parte para salir adelante, además que confían en sus negocios y su capacidad D. venta D. productor ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del crédito es para capital D. operación y para incremento D. su mercadería con la compra D. insumos para realizar masitas para vender, adquisición D. ropa al por mayor y también para la adquisición D. herramientas D. trabajo que ayuden a realizar un trabajo mas eficiente. Dentro D. la Institución van cursando su segundo ciclo sin ninguna dificultar demostrando tener ganas para sacar adelante sus negocios ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familia que es su razón para seguir trabajando.Las esposa D. dos D. los socios se encuentran en la foto como sus representantes debido a que no podian abandonar sus puestos D. trabajo.

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Arbol De Vida Group

texts.es:
L. señora Maria ManueL. Jiménez, natural D. Junín, tiene 44 años casada con 3 hijos vive en L. zona baja D. huaycan, distrito D. Ate, departamento Lima.
Trabaja con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desD. hace 6 años, actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta D. L. alcancía comunal “Árbol D. Vida” integrada por 13 socios quienes realizan diversas actividades como producción, comercio y servicio.
María desD. hace 4 años cuenta con una bodega, (años atrás era negociante ambulante D. golosinas, con el cual no le permitía cuidar D. sus hijos), motivo por el cual  apertura L. bodega en su domicilio para no descuidar D. sus hijos y poder contar con mas ingresos y  para apoyar a su familia. Hasta el momento ha logrado construir su casa, pagar L. carrera D. su hija y comprar sus cosas para el hogar.
Con su reciente préstamo lo invertirá en L. compra D. mercadería para su bodega con el cual le permitirá  abastecer a sus clientes y también lo utilizara para cubrir costos D. titulación en enfermería D. su  hija. 
En el futuro le gustaría seguir contribuyendo a mejorar L. educación D. sus hijos y  terminar con L. construcción D. su casa.
texts.en:
María ManueL. Jiménez, a native of Junín, is 44 years old and married with three children. She lives in the lower zone of Huaycan in the Ate district of the Lima province. She has worked with EDAPROSPO - Prosperity for six years, and is currently the president of the "Tree of Life" Village Bank, which is composed of 13 members who carry out various activities such as production, traD., and service. For four years María has had a store. Years ago, she was a traveling candy saleswoman, which did not allow her to care for her children, and this motivated her to open the store in her home so she could be with her children, earn more income, and support her family. Up to now she has succeeded in building her house, paying for her daughter's education, and buying things for her home. With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of merchandise for her store to fulfill her customers' needs, and she will also use it to cover costs associated with her daughter's nursing degree. In the future, she would like to continue contributing to the improvement of her children's education and to finish the construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: it will be invested in the purchase of merchandise for a store

loans.name: Señor Del Milagro Group

texts.es: El grupo " Señor D. Milagros" esta representados por la señora Maria y conformado por 13 miembros los cuales se encuentran comprendidos entre los 20 a 55 años son personas dinámicas y activas como lo han ido demostrando en sus anteriores ciclos. Una mayoría D. las socias se dedica a la venta D. distintos productos abarrotes, comida, cosméticos, pan y la presidenta se dedica a la costura D. prendas D. vestir. En cuanto a la competencia las socias saben como controlarla gracias a su experiencia y a su clientela Leal. El destino del crédito es para hacer crecer sus negocios, aumentar su capital, adquirir material para agrandar sus negocios y generar mas ingresos para poder darles a sus familias una mayor oportunidad en al vida. Dentro D. la Institución van cursando su Segundo ciclo sin ninguna dificultar demostrando tener ganas para sacar adelante sus negocios ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familia que es su razón para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The group "Lord of Miracles" is represented by María and composed of 13 members who range from 20 to 55 years in age. These people are dynamic and active, as they have demonstrated during their previous cycles. A majority of the members sell various grocery products including food, cosmetics and bread, and the president is a seamstress. As for the competence of the members, they know how to run things thanks to their experience and loyal clientele. The purpose of the loan is to help their businesses grow, increase their capital, acquire materials to increase the size of their businesses and generate more income in order to give their families better opportunities in life. Within the Institute, they are currently in their second cycle, and they have had no difficulty in demonstrating their desire to move forward with their businesses, since the sustenance of their families depends on it and is their reason to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: operating capital

loans.name: Melodia Group

texts.es: “Melodía”, es la denominación de la asociación comunal que reúne a un grupo de doce mujeres trabajadoras, la mayoría con responsabilidades familiares, es decir, casadas y con  hijos, en algunos casos sus esposos no tienen una fuente de empleo fija. Esta situación las ha obligado a ser responsables de sus familias y de los gastos de la casa, como ser la alimentación, estudios y necesidades de los hijos, por tal motivo han decidido emprender pequeños negocios, que por lo general se basan en el  comercio de mercadería de todo tipo, por ejemplo Herminia realiza viajes al interior del país,  llevando ropa para venderlas en ferias, Lucia vende Chamarras de cuero en la calle Tumusla de la ciudad de La Paz, Wilma vende carne de pollo, Tatiana vende cosméticos por catalogo, Ninoska vende CDS. Ellas precisan capital para comprar mercadería y así aumentar sus ventas, de este modo  generar los recursos suficientes para hacer frente a las necesidades de sus familias.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Refurbish his trucks

loans.name: Estela  Marcelina

texts.es: doña Estela es originaria del cantón cojxac de 22 años de edad con residencia  en tierra colorada lugar muy hermoso por sus bosque que se tiene su principal ingreso es la elaboracion de  canastas de plasticos ella aprendio dicha actividad como operaria pero hace dos años inicio su propio negocio lo que le hace falta hoy en dia es capital ya que tiene un pedido que entregar para el mes de Noviembre, su producto lo vende en Matzatenango y Totonicapan.
texts.en:
Doña Estela is originally from Cantón Cojax. She is 22 years old and lives in Tierra Colorada which is a very beautiful place because of it´s forests. Her principal form of income is making plastic hampers. She learned this business as an operator and then two years ago began her own business. What she now lacks is financial backing as she already has an order due in the month of November. She sells her product in Matzatenango and Totonicapan.

Translated from Spanish by Tess Siemer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in Capital

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.en:
Oswaldo says that he loves being his own boss. After a successful career for working for various companies and a large distributor, he decided that he would break out on his own. Two and a half years later, Oswaldo’s dry-goods distribution business now has two employees and serves local delis, variety stores, and grocery stores in his Queens neighborhood. 

Oswaldo has requested a loan of $6,000 to increase his inventory of dry goods. Priding himself on keeping his costs to a minimum, he has identified two major areas that will allow him to reduce overhead and inventory costs to a minimum. 

Now, when Oswaldo makes a sale, he immediately takes the money to a wholesaler to make his next purchase. This process requires multiple trips each day and wastes large amounts of time and money. With a bit of a cash cushion, Oswaldo will be able to reduce the number of times he will have to visit a distributor, thereby saving on gas and time. Also, Oswaldo will be able to buy sale items in bulk. With a continuously growing business, he has spent all of his earned money on expansion and will now be able to reduce his costs simultaneously.

Despite starting a small business in a difficult economy, Oswaldo has grown his business into an established, profitable venture. With his loan, he will continue to expand his business. In the next five years he plans to purchase computers, create a Web site, and set up an electronic record-keeping system. His long term plan? “Keep growing!”

loans.use: Dry goods inventory

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Doña Gladys es originaria y con residencia en el paraje panima final de la zona 1 del Municipio de Totonicapn la actividad es la elaboracion de canastos de plasticos, ella manifiesta que toda su familia se dedica a la misma activida y que dicho producto los vende en Guatemala,Matzatenango, chimaltenago, y en el mercado de la localidad, anteriormente compra su material de la Republica del Salvador hoy compra su materiales en el departamento de Totonicapan, y el costo en accecible si compra por mayor y para ello necesita del un credito.
texts.en:
Ms. Gladys is lives in Panima Final located in Zone 1 in the town of Totonicapan, where she and the rest of her family make plastic baskets which they sell in the local marketplace and in Guatemala City, Matzatenango, Chimaltenago. She used to buy her supplies from suppliers in El Salvador, but now she buys them in Totonicapan. Costs are lower if she buys in bulk and is requesting this loan to be able to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Supplies

loans.name: Edgar David

texts.es: El Joven David es originario de la comunidad de Juchanep a ocho kilometros de la ciudad procer de Totonicapn, el hace cuatro años inicio su propio negocio en la confeccion de playeras, gorras y sus principales  puntos de ventas son ciudad de Guatemala y San Francisco el Alto el cuenta con su propio taller con tres operarios hoy necesita de un credito para la compra de telas, conos, pinturas, para surtir su mercaderia para aprovechar la epoca de fin de año.
texts.en:
David is a young man who lives in the town of Juchanep, located eight kilometers (about five miles) from the city of Totonicapn. Four years ago he started his own business making hats and t-shirts, which he primarily sells in Guatemala City and San Francisco el Alto. He has three employees who work in his shop. He needs a loan to buy fabrics, cones and paints in order to add variety to his products and take advantage of the yearend holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Supplies

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo G. R. es un señor de 49 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en una comunidad llamada las Nubes localizada en los chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Desde muy joven don Eduardo se ha dedicado a la siembra de piña, por lo tanto, dice que tiene bastante experiencia en el cuidado y mantenimiento de esta clase de cultivo tiene un terreno en el cual ha sembrado piña anteriormente y le ha dado muy buenos resultados a la hora de distribuirlo por lo cual desea expandir su plantación, ya que gracias a este negocio la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita don Eduardo es un micro crédito de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones), para comprar hijos de piña, y diferentes insumos para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su cosecha, así al final podrá ser recompensado y podrá tener una muy buena producción. 

Don Eduardo es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Las Nubes, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su tercer préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Eduardo G. R. is a 49-year old man who lives with his wife and three children in a town called las Nubes in the region of Los Chiles, Alajuela province; this community is located in a mountainous areas near the country's northern border. The region's main economic activities are raising cattle and agriculture, more specifically staple crops such as sugar cane and oranges. From an early age, don Eduardo has cultivated pineapple and has vast experience with the care and growth of this crop; he has a small plot of land where he grows pineapples with good results when he takes the produce to market. For this reason he wishes to expand the area under cultivation, to continue to provide well for his family. Eduardo is requesting a small loan of ¢500,000 (five hundred thousand colones), in order to buy small pineapple plants to grow as well as other products to maintain the crop and better his harvest. In this way, he will be able to increase production considerably. Don Eduardo is a member of the Communal Credit Association of Las Nubes, one of 100 organizations within EDESA in Costa Rica. This loan would be his third and he expects it will benefit his business and personal finances as a result. He also notes that prior loans have allowed him to dedicate more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inputs and products for planting and harvesting pineapples

loans.name: Las Esteritas Group

texts.es:
La señora Natividad C., natural D.  Huancayo, tiene 65 años, casada con 3 hijos vive en la zona baja D. Huaycan, distrito D. Ate, departamento Lima.
Trabaja con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desD. hace 1año y medio, actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta D. la alcancía comunal “Las Esteritas” integrada por 11 socios quienes realizan diversas actividades como: producción, comercio y servicio.
Natividad se dedica al alquiler D. cuartos desD. hace 10 años, empezó a trabajar en este negocio a raíz que su esposo falleció, no tuvo mejor idea que alquilar los cuartos D. su casa para así no  descuidar D. sus hijos y  contar así con un ingreso más para su hogar. Hasta el momento ha logrado construir su casa y mejorar la educación D. sus hijos.
Con su reciente préstamo lo invertirá en acondicionar los cuartos para alquiler y en el futuro le gustaría abrir una bodega.
texts.en:
Mrs Natividad C., 65, married with 3 children, comes from Huancayo and lives in the lower area of Huaycan, in the district of Ate, department of Lima. She has worked with EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad for one and a half years. She currently occupies the role of president of the communal bank "Las Esteritas", maD. up of 11 partners who carry out diverse activities such as production, traD. and services.

Natividad has worked renting rooms for 10 years. She started work in this business after her husband passed away as she didn't have a better idea than renting rooms in her house to increase her income for the home and avoid neglecting her children. So far, she has been able to build her house and improve the education of her children. With the current loan, she will invest in fitting-out the rooms for rental and in the future, she would like to open a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in fitting-out rooms for rental.

loans.name: Filomena Eulalia

texts.es: Doña Filomena Eulalia B. con residencia en la comunidad D. Juchanep Totonicapan ella es madre soltera con  tres hijos su actividad principal es la tejeduria en la elaboracion D. cortes tipicos D. diferentes diseños D. lo mas sencillo a lo moderno ya que es un traje muy utilizado por la mujeres D. del occidente del pais D. Guatemal principalmente el altiplano por ser un lugar muy frio y sus lindos bosques naturales, ella necesita D. un credito que sera invertido en la compra D. Hilo, labores, tintas. ella manifiesta que quiere aprovechas el timpo D. vaciones D. sus hijos para incrementar su produccion.

loans.use: Compra de Materiales

loans.name: Odilie

texts.es:
Odilie H. B. es una señora de 38 años de edad el cual vive con su esposo y sus 2  hijos en una comunidad llamada las Nubes localizada en los chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Doña Odilie se dedica a la producción de leche y queso como una forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Dice estar muy contenta porque gracias a este proyecto ha podido salir adelante y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y de sus hijos. 

Doña Odilie desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar dos vacas lecheras más y así aumentar la producción de leche. Ella sabe que contar con más vacas es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo. Sin embargo, el deseo de ser una microempresaria exitosa y  sacar adelante a su familia mejorando las condiciones de vida, la motiva a esforzarse con gran esmero y dedicación.

Doña Odilie es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Las Nubes, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su tercer préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Odilie H. B. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the community of Las Nubes, which is located in Los Chiles in Alajuela Province. This area is in a mountainous region near the northern border of the country. The main economic activities are livestock breeding and agriculture, specifically the planting and harvesting of basic grains, sugar cane, and oranges.

Doña Odilie is a dairy farmer who produces milk and cheese in order to generate income for her family. She is very happy that her business has enabled her to move forward and help her husband with the household expenses and her children’s welfare.

Doña Odilie is seeking to obtain a microloan of 500,000 colones to buy two more dairy cows in order to increase her milk production. She knows that having more cows requires great sacrifice and demands more work. However, her desire to be a successful micro-entrepreneur and improve her family’s living conditions motivates her to continue working with great care and dedication.

Doña Odilie is a member of Las Nubes Community Credit Enterprise, one of the 100 partner organizations affiliated with EDESA in Costa Rica. This is her third loan and she hopes to continue growing personally and economically. She is grateful for these types of organizations and providers of credit who dedicate their time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Eva Paulina

texts.es: La Señora Eva Paulina es originaria de la comunidad de Juchanep ella es casada de 20 años de edad hace cinco años inicio su propio negocio en la venta de ropa su lugar de venta en las calles del Municipio de Totonicapan  lugar que le autorizaron por el señor alcalde municipal, con los ingresos obtenidos ha mejorado su nivel de vida pero se requiere de un capital suficiente para poder competir ella necesita de un credito para surtir su mercaderia ya que se aproxima la fiesta del municipio de Totonicapan.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eva Paulina is from the community of Juchanep. She is 20 years old and married. Five years ago she started her own business selling clothes as a street vendor in Totonicapan as she was authorized by the municipal mayor. With her earnings she has been able to improve her standard of living but she needs enough capital to be able to compete. She needs a loan to stock her merchandize as the municipal holiday approaches the municipality of Totonicapan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her capital.

loans.name: Arnoldo

texts.es:
Arnoldo R. F. es un señor de 60 años de edad el cual vive con su padre y sus dos hijos en una comunidad llamada las Nubes localizada en los chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Don Arnoldo se dedica a la ganadería de doble propósito, tanto en producción de leche y queso como la venta de carne; ya que es una forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Dice estar muy contento porque gracias a este proyecto ha podido salir adelante poder mantener a sus hijos y darle los cuidados necesarios  a su padre. 

Don Arnoldo desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢300.000 (trescientos mil colones) para comprar dos vacas lecheras más y así aumentar la producción de leche. El sabe que contar con más vacas es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo. Sin embargo, el deseo de ser una microempresario exitoso y sacar adelante a su familia mejorando las condiciones de vida, lo motiva a esforzarse con gran esmero y dedicación.

Don Arnoldo es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Las Nubes, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su tercer préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Arnoldo R. F. is 60 years old and lives with his father and his two children in the Nubes community in the province of Alajuela. This community stands out for being a mountainous zone and for being very close to the northern frontier of the country. The principal economic activities are livestock and agriculture, more specifically growing basic grains, sugar cane and oranges.

Don Arnoldo devotes his time to livestock with a double purpose, to produce milk and cheese as well as selling meat as it is a way to generate income for his family. He is very happy because thanks to his work, he has been able to do well enough to support his children and give necessary care to his father.

Don Arnoldo requests a micro-loan for ¢300.000 (three hundred thousand colones) to buy two more milk cows to increase the milk supply. He knows that to have more cows is a great sacrifice and will require more work. Nonetheless, the desire to be a successful micro-entrepreneur and to improve the standard of living of his family motivates him to try his best with great attention to detail and dedication.

Don Arnoldo is a member of The Communal Loan Company Las Nubes; it is one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This would be his third loan and with it, he hopes to grow more in a personal and economic level. He also emphasizes that thanks to these types of organizations that make these types of loans possible, he can dedicate more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two cows.

loans.name: Badara

texts.en:
Four years ago, Badara started a business exporting goods to his native Senegal. He sends products like electronics and clothing from the U.S. to his daughter, who sells them back home. He loves being able to provide a livelihood for his daughter that will pay her expenses and education back home, rather than just giving her money. 

Badara is a long-time ACCION USA borrower and this is his fourth loan. He started with a $500 loan to build his credit and has taken out incrementally larger loans since then. He is proud of his stellar repayment record and the fact that he has been able to establish a great credit history in this country, which is not an easy feat.

loans.use: Inventory for export to Senegal

loans.name: Emerita Magdalena

texts.es: La señora Emerita es Originaria del canton Chuisuc ella y su esposo se dedican a la tejeduria en la elaboracion de cortes tipicos para damas, en donde todo el proceso desde su inicio hasta la finalizacion, ello lo realizan con el objetivo de aumentar sus ingresos necesita del apoyo de la institucion ASDIR que les consede un credito ya que escucharon por una emisor radial que ayudad a las personas de escasos recurso economicos,

loans.use: Ampliacion de Capital

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan Manuel es un padre de familia de 37 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en el distrito de Santa Rosa, ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
 
Al igual que la mayoría de hombres del lugar, se dedica eventualmente a la pesca de Anchoveta, pero la temporada de pesca de esta especie empieza en noviembre y sólo dura un mes, por este motivo hace tres años empezó un negocio de distribución de pescado fresco que le ayuda a sostener económicamente a su familia durante las temporadas de veda.
 
El va tres veces por semana hacia el terminal ECOPHINSA (terminal pesquero de la ciudad) para comprar pescado a las cámaras frigoríficas que vienen a desembarcar en el lugar y luego distribuirlo a las ciudades de Jaén y Bagua.
 
Las condiciones climáticas que se han venido dando en la zona durante los últimos meses han derivado en una escacez de pescado, lo que ha causado un incremento en el costo de las principales especies que se comercializan en la región, Juan Manuel, ante esta situación se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 900 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más pescado para mantener su negocio.
 
A largo plazo el desea comprar su propia cámara frigorífica para distribuir más pescado y transportarlo con mayor facilidad sin tener que pagar otro tipo de servicio, por ahora las ganancias que percibe de su negocio las está invirtiendo en la construcción de su casa, para ofrecerle un techo seguro a sus menores hijos.
 
Juan Manuel es una persona muy querida y estimada por sus vecinos, ellos lo consideran un padre de familia alegre, honrado y trabajador.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel, 37, heads a household which includes his wife and four children living in Santa Rosa, some 25 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. Like many in the region, he makes his living from fishing anchovies, but the open fishery season only lasts one month, starting in November. For this reason, three years ago he began a business to distribute fresh fish, an activity that helps sustain his family during the rest of the year. Juan Manuel goes three times per week to the fishing terminal of his city (ECOPHINSA) to buy fish brought in to market for refrigeration; he then distributes the fish to buyers in the cities of Jaén and Bagua. Due to climactic and other factors, the region's fishery is in decline, which has led to increased prices for the main commercial fish species. These difficutlies are why Juan Manuel is seeking a loan for 900 soles from Edpyme Alternativa, so as to be able to buy more product and sustain his business. In the long term, he hopes to buy his own refrigerated container to distribute fish and transport the product more easily without paying others for this service; in this way he could save more on costs and invest additional income in improvements to his house to better care for his children and family. Juan Manuel is a respected man in his community and considered both honorable and hard-working.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fresh fish for distribution and resale

loans.name: Alan Víctor

texts.es:
Alan tiene 24 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa y su pequeña hija de 2 años de edad en casa de sus padres, a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Santa Rosa.
 
La necesidad de trabajar por su familia le ha llevado a crear un pequeño negocio de venta ambulante de pescado, usualmente trabajaba durante la noche como ayudante en una panaderia de la zona y desde hace seis meses también trabaja vendiendo pescado fresco en los pueblos del distrito de Monsefú, ubicado a 10 minutos del lugar en donde vive.
 
El va muy temprano al terminal pesquero del lugar a comprar pescado de tres a cuatro veces por semana, luego viaja hacia Monsefú y vende su mercadería, llega a su casa por la tarde, descansa y después va a la panadería a trabajar; los ingresos generados por estas actividades le sirven para sacar adelante a su familia y también para apoyar a sus padres.
 
Alan desea juntar el dinero suficiente para crear su propia panadería, ya que disfruta mucho de esta actividad y dado el tiempo en que estuvo trabajando ha aprendido ya todo respecto a este oficio, pero es consciente de que debe seguir vendiendo pescado para continuar ahorrando su dinero, es por ello que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 900 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más mercadería para mantener su negocio.
 
Su sueño es poder comprarse un terreno y construir su casa, Alan es muy conocido y respetado por sus vecinos y compañeros de trabajo que lo consideran un joven cariamático, responsable y trabajador.
texts.en:
Alan is 24 years old and lives with his wife and 2-year old daughter in his parents’ house, located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo in the Santa Rosa district. The need to work to support his family led him to start a small business selling fresh fish on foot. He usually works at night as an assistant in a bakery in the area. For the past six months, he has also been working selling fish in the towns located in the Monsefú district, which is ten minutes from where he lives. He goes very early to the docks to buy his fish, and then travels to Monsefú to sell his product. He arrives home in the afternoon, rests, and then goes to the bakery to work. The income he generates through these activities helps him get ahead in supporting his family and his parents. Alan wants to gather enough funds to start his own bakery, since he very much enjoys this activity and has been learning the trade for some time. However, he is conscious that he must continue selling fish in order to save money. For this reason, he is approaching Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 900 soles. He thinks he will invest these funds into the purchase of more merchandise to strengthen his enterprise. His dream is to buy some land on which to build his own house. Alan is well-known and respected by his neighbors and workmates, who consider him a charismatic, responsible and hard-working young man.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señorita Rosa Maria es originaria de la comunidad de Chuisuc Totonicapan su principal fuente de ingreso es la tejeduria que dicha actividad lo aprendio cuando tenia diez años de su querido padre ella inicio su propio negocio hace tres años actualemte tiene su pequeño taller con tres telares su producto los vende en Salcaja, y chimaltenango los cortes tipicos para damas, necesita de un credito para surtir su mercaderia ser competitivo en el mercado de las artesanias.

loans.use: Ampliacion de Capital

loans.name: María Esmeralda

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en el distito de Santa Rosa, ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
 
Su esposo se dedica a la pesca de anchoveta, pero debido a las contínuas temporadas de veda, ella se vio en la necesidad de trabajar, fue entonces cuando empezó a distribuir pescado a los comerciantes de la región.
 
María y su esposo van a los puertos de Pimentel, San José y eventualmente a la caleta La Cruz (en la región Tumbes, ubicada a seis horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo) para comprar pescado fresco a los pescadores que recién están desembarcando, luego lo transportan hacia el terminal pesquero ECOPHINSA (el principal terminal pesquero de la región) y  lo venden a los comerciantes de la zona.
 
Anteriormente, con las ganancias de su negocio creó una pequeña bodega – tienda en su casa con la que también se ganaba el sustento diario, pero su esposo en uno de sus viajes a Tumbes enfermó gravemente de dengue y ella tuvo que invertir el poco dinero que tenía para pagar su tratamiento, desde entonces no ha tenido oportunidad de mantener ni implementar la bodega.
 
Ahora que su esposo se ha recuperado ella se encuentra trabajando con muchas ganas para seguir saliendo adelante, tiene planeado comprar más mercadería para hacer crecer su negocio de distribución de pescado y poder comprar sus propias cubetas (cajas para guardar pescado) ya que las que usa por ahora son alquiladas, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1300 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
 
María sueña con poder terminar de construir su casa e implementar su bodega, sus vecinos dan muy buenas referencias de ella, la consideran todo un ejemplo ya que supo salir adelante a pesar de la enfermedad de su esposo.
texts.en:
María is a 28-year-old mother who lives with her husband and four children in the Santa Rosa district, located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Her husband dedicates himself to fishing for anchovies but, due to the times the anchovy fishing season was closed, she saw the need to work. It was at this time that she started to distribute fish to the merchants of the area. María and her husband travel to the Pimentel and San José harbors and, eventually, to the La Cruz cove (in the Tumbes region, located six hours from the city of Chiclayo) to buy fresh fish from the fishermen just off their boats. They then transport their fish to the ECOPHINSA fishing terminal (the primary fishing terminal of the region) and sell them to the dealers of the area. Previously, with earnings from her business, she started a small general store in her house that also generated income for their daily living needs. However, her husband fell gravely ill with dengue fever on one of his visits to Tumbes. She used the little money she had to pay for his treatment and, since then, she hasn’t been able to maintain or stock her store. Now that her husband has recovered, she finds herself working with great enthusiasm to get ahead. She plans to buy more products to help her fish distribution business to grow and to buy her own tanks (containers to store fish), since currently she rents them by the hour. For this reason, she finds herself approaching Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to request a loan of 1,300 soles to help her reach her goals. María’s dreams include finishing the building of her house and stocking her store. Her neighbors provide very good references for her, and consider her a good example since she was able to forge ahead despite her husband’s illness.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad tiene 59 años D. edad, es separada y vive junto a la última D. sus siete hijos en el distrito D. La Victoria, ubicado a cinco minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Ella lleva 27 años viviendo en La Victoria y desD. hace 25 años empezó a alquilar algunas habitaciones D. su casa a estudiantes y trabajadores que provienen D. lugares alejados. Este negocio ha sido la fuente D. ingreso que ha mantenido a su familia durante todo este tiempo.
 
Sus hijos ya son mayores y trabajan en distintos lugares D. la región, ella continúa trabajando con la finalidad D. ayudar a todas las personas que, al igual que ella, vinieron a Chiclayo en busca D. un futuro mejor.
 
Debido a la antigüedad D. su casa, esta necesita D. algunas reparaciones, es por ello que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1200 nuevos soles los cuales piensa invertir en las reparaciones necesarias para que sus habitaciones puedan seguir acogiendo a sus inquilinos por más tiempo.
 
Su más granD. anhelo es construir otra casa para que alguno D. sus hijos se gane la vida en el mismo negocio y también ayuD. a las personas que vienen D. muy lejos a la ciudad. Ella es una mujer muy alegre, carismática y muy querida por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Natividad is 59 years old, separated from her husband, and lives with the youngest of her seven children in the district of La Victoria, located five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has been living in La Victoria for 27 years and, 25 years ago, started renting out some rooms in her home to students and workers who come from distant regions. This business has been the source of income that supported her family over all these years. Her children are now grown and work in different parts of the region. She continues to work with the goal of helping all the people who, like her, come to Chiclayo in search of a brighter future. She needs to make some repairs due to the age of her house. For this reason, she is approaching Edpyme Alternative for the first time to request a loan of 1,200 soles. She plans to invest the funds into making the necessary repairs so that her rooms will continue to attract long-term renters. Her greatest wish is to build another house so that one of her children can earn a living in the same way she has. Also, this would help the people who come from far away to the city looking for work. She is a happy, charismatic woman who is very dear to all her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to her rental rooms.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia S. is from the village of Salimpuno,Pana-on,Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Eulalia is married and has 2 adult-aged children.

To make a living, Eulalia owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating pedicab transport services. Eulalia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Eulalia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eulalia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories.

Eulalia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional tires and other accessories. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Eulalia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional tires and other accessories

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe N. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del sur. She is 30 years old. Fe is married and has 2 school-aged children.

To make a living, Fe owns & operates a transportation services business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from tricycle transport services. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to pay for registration, franchise and licenses.

Fe is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Fe from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Segondina

texts.en:
Segondina S. is from the village of Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 58 years old. Segondina is married and has 2 school-aged children.

To make a living, Segondina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling fish. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling fish in local communites. Segondina has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Segondina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Segondina from GDMPC. Segondina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC.

Segondina is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and for daily needs.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is a member of the Kichangani borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 36 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 4 and 3 years  old.

Frida has owned a shop business  for 6 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

loans.name: Tnaomat B1 Group

texts.en:
Sem T. is a 45-year-old farmer who is the leader for a group of 7 people – Tnaomat B1.  Sem lives in Naiotel, Taebenu Sub District- Kupang District. It is situated about 30 km from and takes about three hours from Kupang City by motorbike. The road to the village is bumpy and has not been asphalted; it is still stony so it is hard for public transport such as minivans to enter the village. In order to reach the village, people usually use motorbikes or trucks. Naiotel is a remote village; there are no local markets or education and health facilities available in this village. If a family member is sick then they bring him/her to the local clinic which is situated about 5 km from their village.    

Only 40 households live in Naiotel Village. Most people in the village have backgrounds as farmers but they usually face difficulty in the dry season as the weather is hot and they have to fetch water from the river which is about 1 km from their houses. 

In the rainy season, the community is keen to cultivate vegetables, peanuts, corn and produce coconut oil. They usually sell the agricultural produce in Tunbaun Market (about 22 km from the village) and Oeba Market in Kupang City (about 30 km). They take motorcycle taxis to bring their produce to the market. It costs IDR 30,000 per return trip. In the dry season they can not sell the produce as the farm is dry; they can not plant vegetables, peanuts and corn. In order to finance the family's daily needs, the community usually digs manganese every day to be sold. The price is IDR 1,100/kg.

Sem is a married man and a father of 6 children. The children live with him and his wife. They are:

-	Marni, who only graduated from elementary school. She could not continue to high school as Sem was unable to finance her education.
-	Jermi in the Second Grade of Senior High School, Sem’s brother helped Jermi so he could continue to High School.
-	Yanti in the Second Grade of Junior High School
-	Yeti in the Third Grade of Elementary School
-	Yona is 3 years old, not at school yet.
-	Dina is 1 year old, not at school yet.       

Sem realizes that he has to find another option to improve his family's life so that he is able to meet his children's education fees and their daily needs. He heard about TLM's cattle fattening program from the field officer. He is interested in joining the program. Together with other farmers who are also interested in joining the program, they formed a group in order to receive loans to buy cattle to be fattened over 12 month period.  Sem is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 3,400,000 from TLM to buy young cattle. The other group members of Tnaomat B1 are also requesting a loan to buy young cattle. All of them hope to have improvement in their lives through the loan.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Tnaomat B2 Group

texts.en:
Tnaomat B2 is a group of eight people in Naiotel Village, Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara Province. Naiotel Village is far away from crowded Kupang City. It is situated about 30 km and it takes about 3 hours to reach the village from Kupang City. This village can be categorized as a remote village. Most people in the village support their families by farming, raising goats, pigs and chickens. The condition of the road is bumpy and stony so it is difficult to reach the village. 

Tnaomat B2 is led by Olimpas B. - a 43-year-old farmer. He is married and has four children. They are married and live separate from Olimpas and his wife. Olimpas was born and grew up in Naiotel Village.  In order to fulfill his family's daily needs, Olimpas works as a farmer. He has a big farm to plant vegetables, corn, beans, tomatoes and chilies but in the dry season, Olimpas faces difficulty in watering his plants. He has to walk for about 1 km to reach the river in order to fetch water.  

In the dry season, people in this village, including Olimpas, usually generate income by digging manganese so they can support their families. They sell the manganese at IDR 1,100/ kg.   

Olimpas starts to find manganese in the morning and works until the evening. He works as a manganese seeker in the dry season while waiting for the rainy season to cultivate his farm. Olimpas’s wife always stores up corn when it's harvest time because they usually consume it in the dry season when rice is expensive for them to buy. 

Olimpas saw some people who live close to his house were able improve their lives by fattening cattle to be sold. They can renovate their houses and finance their children's school fees up to High School. Olimpas then was interested to join the Cattle Fattening Program as he wants to improve his family's lives. Olimpas formed a group which is called Tnaomat B Group. Olimpas is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 3,400,000 to buy calves to be fattened for 12 months. The other group members are also requesting a loan as they want to improve their living standard.  

Note: When the group picture was taken, Benyamin and Atrianus were replaced by their family members.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

However she is happy that the loans have managed to keep her standing even in the worst of times, by having quality produce. She hopes to become a wholesale supplier of agricultural produce so that she can be able to earn much. Saidat needs a loan to be able to buy more drinks like soda and mineral water for resale.

She started with the sale of clothes and changed for the better and is not regretting. She hopes to become a wholesale supplier of agricultural produce so that she can be able to earn much. She needs a loan to help buy more agricultural produce for resale since this widens her profits and enables the payment of school fees. She is such a hard working lady.

loans.name: Florence's Group
