loans.name: Las Pioneras Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Las Pioneras” se formo en el año 2006, integrada por  10 socios quienes se encuentra ubicados en la zona alta D. Huaycan, distrito D. Ate, departamento Lima y realizan diversas actividades como: venta D. chupetes, venta D. ropa, venta D. cereales, venta D. abarrotes, venta D. bolsas comerciales, venta D. productos D. belleza, prestan servicio D. costura y locutorio, etc.
Trabajan con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desD. hace 3 años, actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta D. la alcancía comunal  la señora Albina Q., quien se integro a la alcancía desD. hace 1 año y 4 meses, ella es natural D. Lima, tiene 48 años conviviente  y con 2 hijos. Albina se dedica  a la venta D. productos D. belleza y en la temporada D. verano se dedica a la venta D. chupetes y gelatinas en los colegios, viene trabajando en este negocio, gracias a una amiga que la ánimo a participar y poder ganarse así un ingreso adicional sin descuidar D. sus hijos.
Con su reciente préstamo comprara productos D. belleza en oferta para poder venderlos a sus clientes y así poder generar  más  ingresos para su hogar.
 En el futuro le gustaría mucho poder construir su casa, mejorar en nivel D. educación D. sus hijos y también llegar a establecer un negocio D. venta D. comida.
texts.en:
The communal piggy bank, "Las Pioneras", formed in the year 2006 and is maD. up of ten members who are located in the high zone of Huaycan, Ate district, Lima department and work in different areas such as selling lollipops, clothing, cereal, groceries, shopping bags, beauty products, sewing services or phone services, etc. They have worked with EDAPROSPO -- Prosperidad for three years. Currently, Albina Q., who joined a year and four months ago, assumes the role of president of the communal piggy bank. She is a native of Lima, is 48 years old and lives with her partner and has two children. Albina is dedicated to selling beauty products and, in summer, she sells lollipops and gelatins at schools. She came to work in this business thanks to a friend who encouraged her to participate and in this way she was able to earn an additional income without neglecting her children. With her recent loan, she will purchase beauty products on sale in order to be able to sell them to her customers and be able to generate M. income for her home. In the future, she would like to be able to build a house, improve the level of education of her children and also establish a business selling food.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase beauty products on sale in order to be able to sell them to her customers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a business lady who owns a food kiosk in Mihang’o Nairobi. She has been in this business for the past two years. She is requesting a loan of Kes 50,000 in order to add to her stock of flour, rice and sugar. Victoria hopes to open many branches of the same business and have a stable family one day. She describes herself as friendly and a peacekeeper.



About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Florecitas De Villa Hermosa Group

texts.es:
La alcancía  comunal “Florecitas de Villa Hermosa”; esta conformada por 12 socios, ellos  tienen como afinidad, de que todos los integrantes son vecinos del  mismo barrio de Villa Hermosa, de ahí se origina el nombre de su alcancía, esta ubicado en la entrada de Huaycan  del distrito Ate, departamento de Lima. 
Trabajan con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desde hace 3 años actualmente asume el cargo de presidenta la señora Maribel L., natural de Lima,  conviviente y con un hijo de 13 años.
Maribel es emprendedora e ingeniosa realiza 2 actividades, se dedica la venta de ropa en forma ambulatoria desde hace  6 años y también a la venta de comida junto con su hermano desde hace 10 años. Con su nuevo préstamo Maribel lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de temporada para así cubrir los pedidos solicitados y en los insumos para la preparación de los diferentes menús.
Nuestros socios se  dedican a diferentes actividades: una de ellas a la venta de neumáticos (llantas), otra se dedica a los tejidos a crochet y a palitos, 3 se dedican a la venta de productos de belleza, 2 tienen su tienda de abarrotes, otra socia vende comida y es cocinera, 3 socias se dedican a la venta de ropa,
una socia tiene su restaurante y un socio presta servicio de moto taxi. Todos nuestros socios tienen el deseo de aumentar sus ganancias y  en invertir para mejorar sus ingresos y la educación de sus hijos.
Nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo que les brindan Edaprospo - Prosperidad mediante los préstamos y se comprometen en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The Florecitas de Villa Hermosa Communal Bank is comprised of 12 members. They have great affinity for each other. They are all neighbors in the Villa Hermosa neighborhood, which is how they got the name for their communal bank. It is located at the entrance to Huaycan in the Ate district, Lima department. They have worked with EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad for three years. Maribel L., who is from Lima, is the president. She is in a common law marriage and has a 13 year old son. Maribel is enterprising and clever woman who does two activities. She is a street vendor who sells clothes. She has done this for six years. For ten years she has also been selling food with her brother. With the new loan Maribel will buy seasonal clothes to cover orders and buy supplies for preparing different meals. Our members are involved in different activities. One of them sells pneumatics (tires), another crochets and knits, three sell beauty products, two have grocery stores, another member sells food and is a cook, three members sell clothes, one member has a restaurant, and one member provides “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized cart) services. All of our members have the desire to increase their earnings and to invest in order to increase their incomes for their children’s education. Our members are grateful for the support offered through loans by Edaprospo – Prosperidad. They promise to make their payments on the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seasonal clothes to cover orders and supplies to make different meals

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
L. alcancía comunal “LAS PALMERAS” esta integrada por 12 socios, quienes  han demostrando honestidad, responsabilidad y sobre todo ganas D. salir adelante; esta ubicado en L. zona alta D. Huaycan distrito D. Ate departamento D. Lima. 
Actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta D. L. alcancía comunal L. señora Gladys S., casada, con 5 hijos y se dedica a L. venta D. ropa en forma ambulatoria. 
Trabajan con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad, desD. hace 5 años y realizan diversas actividades como: venta D. gaseosas, cervezas, golosinas, plásticos, pasteles, ropas y accesorios para el hogar, venta D. comidas y ceviches. Gladys manifiesta que L. competencia  comercial es alta pero los socios tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios, ofreciendo productos variados y D. buena calidad. Con el reciente préstamo, es para aumentar nuestro capital D. trabajo para adquirir mercaderías e insumos para seguir generando mas ingresos para nuestras familias con el cual nos permite  mejorar L. educación D. nuestros hijos, por ello estamos muy agradecidos por L. confianza depositada y  seguir trabajando con más entusiasmo con L. Institución.
texts.en:
The “Las Palmeras” communal bank is maD. up of 12 members who have demonstrated honesty, responsibility, and, above all, the will to get ahead. It is located in the high zone of the Huaycan district of Ate, department of Lima.

Currently, the job of president of the communal bank is taken on by señora Gladys, married with 5 children and engaged in the sale of clothing on an itinerant basis. We have worked with EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad for 5 years and carry out diverse activities such as the sale of soda water, beer sweets, plastics, pastries, clothes, household accessories, food, and ceviches.

Gladys states that our commercial competence is high because the members have a lot of experience and know how to promote their businesses, offering varied products of good quality. The recent loan application is to add to our working capital and to acquire merchandise and raw materials in order to generate more income for our families. This will permit us to improve the education of our children. We are very thankful for the confidence shown to us and will continue working with more enthusiasm with the Institution.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to increase our working capital and acquire merchandise and raw material

loans.name: Balbina

texts.es:
Balbina tiene 45 años, es una mujer muy cariñosa, vive en una habitación alquilada con sus 3 hijos: Alberto de 25, Ricardo de 24 y Luis de 22, quienes la ayudan mucho en el trabajo. Su negocio es el alquiler de carpas, sillas y mesas para eventos sociales y en cualquier fiesta local es muy solicitada, ya que sus cosas están muy bien cuidadas y el precio que ofrece es muy accesible. Ella decidió por este trabajo, porque le permite tener libertad y no tiene un jefe que la presione, además puede dedicarles tiempo a sus hijos y velar por sus estudios. Lleva 3 años desempeñándose en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cargar las pesadas carpas hasta los lugares donde se las alquilan. Para el futuro anhela juntar el dinero necesario para implementar una tienda de abarrotes.
Este es el cuarto préstamo de Balbina con MFP y al igual como hizo en sus primeros créditos desea pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que sabe que sino meterá en problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada por lo responsable que es. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevas sillas y mesas, con lo cual espera poder subir un poco más el precio del alquiler.
texts.en:
Balbina is 45 years old. She is a charming lady who rents her home and lives with her three sons, Alberto, age 25; Ricardo, age 24; and Luis, age 22, who help her very much in her work. She runs a business renting out tents, tables and chairs for social events. She is well sought out by customers, as her items are well cared for and her prices are reasonable. She chose this business because it allows her flexibility and she does not have a "boss" to pressure her. It also allows her to spend time with her sons and stay up late studying. She has run this business for three years and considers the most difficult part to be carrying the heavy tents to the renters' places. In the future she will save up the money needed to open store selling groceries. This will be Baliba's fourth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). As with her previous loans, she plans to make her payments on time, because she knows that not doing so will cause problems for her community bank, with whom she has earned a good reputation for being responsible. With this loan of "500 Soles" ($175 US), she will invest in new tables and chairs, which she expects to be able to rent out for slightly higher prices.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tables and charis to rent out

loans.name: Betchsabe

texts.es:
Betchsabe tiene 39 años, es una mujer muy amable y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos, Danny de 22 y Ronald de 6 años, a quienes desea dar una buena vida. Su pequeña bodega está ubicada en el Barrio Espinar de la ciudad de Juliaca, su tienda es muy concurrida por sus vecinos, ya que saben que ahí encontraran todo lo que necesitan. Los días de Betchsabe comienzan muy temprano por la mañana, pues mientras más temprano habrá, tendrá más posibilidades de vender más. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 2 años con este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda. Para el futuro espera que su tienda crezca y pueda brindarles un mejor servido a sus clientes.
Este es el cuarto préstamo de Bechsabe con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causar problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por sus compañeras. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para su bodega, ya que desea ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia tiene 23 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Martín de 23 años y sus 2 hijos: Tony y Henry de 3 años, a quienes desea darles una buena calidad de vida. Su negocio es la venta de artefactos de segunda mano, el cual le ha dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Ella tiene su puesto en la Explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), el cual es muy concurrido por las personas que buscan algo útil de segunda mano o simplemente un repuesto. Lo que más le gusta a Delia de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta y hacer su mañana más amena. Lleva 5 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es salir a buscar artefactos usados que aun sirvan o que pueda arreglar. Para el futuro anhela tener una tienda de abarrotes con la cual pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos. 
Este es el tercer préstamo de Delia con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es muy responsable y siempre está pendiente de que se cumplan los acuerdos a los que llegan entre todas. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más artefactos para arreglarlos y ponerlos a la venta.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 52 años, es una mujer muy luchadora, vive en una casa como cuidante junto a sus 3 hijos: Huber D. 21, Marta D. 14 y Jesús 9 años, quienes son el motivo D. todos sus esfuerzos. Su carretilla D. golosinas se encuentra ubicada en el Parque Bolognesi, (parque importante D. la ciudad D. Juliaca), el cual es muy concurrido por sus clientes, ya que ella siempre los atienD. con mucha amabilidad y una sonrisa en los labios. Su carretilla tiene una gran variedad D. productos, lo que ha hecho que su negocio le sea muy rentable. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer bajo el inclemente clima, ya que a veces hace mucho calor y a veces mucho frío. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda D. abarrotes donD. pueda vender sus golosinas con mayor tranquilidad.
Este es el cuarto préstamo D. Elsa con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal siempre está al tanto D. todos los acuerdos a los que lleguen su grupo. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su carretilla.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 27 años, es una joven madre de familia muy alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a sus dos hijos: Joel de 7  y Omar de 6 años, a quienes desea dar unos buenos estudios. Su negocio de golosinas está ubicado en la Explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), su puesto es muy concurrido por las personas que asisten a la feria, ya que prefieren comprarle a ella debido a la amabilidad y alegría con que atiende a sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta a Esther de su trabajo es que tiene la libertad para cuidar a sus hijos mientras vende sus golosinas, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto, pues tiene que cuidar y vender sus productos todo el tiempo. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda de abarrotes con la cual pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
Este es el cuarto préstamo de Esther con MFP y se siente muy confiada de poder pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causar problemas en su banco comunal, donde es muy querida, pues es la socia más joven y alegre. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas y otros productos comestibles para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucía tiene 56 años, es una mujer muy alegre y conversadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo José, D. 55 años, y sus 3 hijos: Freddy D. 26, Tito D. 20 y Néstor D. 24 años; y juntos trabajan duro para salir adelante. Ella se dedica a la venta D. golosinas, este trabajo le ha brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que le pone todo su empeño para mejorarlo. Su carretilla está ubicada en una D. las esquinas del Parque Bolognesi (parque importante D. la ciudad D. Juliaca). Lo que más le gusta a Lucía D. su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 18 años dedicándose a este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día bajo los calurosos rayos solares. Para el futuro espera hacer crecer su negocio y poner una tienda D. golosinas bien granD., donD. pueda atender a sus clientes con mayor comodidad.
Este es el cuarto préstamo D. Lucia con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad D. pagarlo a tiempo, puesto que no quiere meter en problemas a las socias D. su banco comunal, donD. es muy querida debido a la alegría que le pone a las reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su carretilla y así ofrecerles una mayor variedad a sus clientes.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 55 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 4 hijos: Marino de 25, Delia de 24, Yolanda de 22 y Néstor de 13 años, a quienes desea darles una buena vida. Su puesto de golosinas es uno de los más concurridos de su barrio, ella es una vendedora muy alegre y convincente, por lo que trata de atender muy bien a sus clientes para que siempre regresen. Si bien la mercancía que tiene no es mucha, Margarita siempre se las arregla para comprar solo lo que más demanda tiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, tiene 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día pendiente de su puesto para que no se pierda nada. Para el futuro espera tener una bodega donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes.
Este es el cuarto préstamo de Margarita con MFP y está muy contenta por la oportunidad de crédito, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo para no perjudicar a sus compañeras de banco comunal, donde es muy querida. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su puesto de golosinas.
texts.en:
Margarita, 55, is a very happy mother. She lives in her own house with her four children. Marino is 25, Delia is 24, Yolanda is 22, and Néstor is 13. She wants to give them a good life. Her candy stand is one of the busiest in her neighborhood. She is a very cheerful and convincing salesperson. She tries to take very good care of her customers so that they always return. If she does not have much merchandise, Margarita always arranges to buy only what is in the most demand. What she likes best about her work is talking with her customers. She has been in this business for ten years. The most difficult part is having to stay at her stand all day so she does not miss anything. In the future she hopes to have a store when she can better wait on her customers. This is Margarita’s fourth loan with MFP. She is very happy to have the opportunity of the loan. She knows that she has to make all of her payments on time so she does not hurt her colleagues in her communal bank where she is much loved. She will use the 700 PEN that she is asking for to buy more products to better stock her candy stand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

She is a simple, hard working entrepreneur who has spent eight years buying and selling local chicken breeds. She buys her stock cheaply from the locals especially during market days and supplies to nearby hotels. The income from her business supports her family. She believes that with a loan of Khs 20,000 her business will improve.

loans.name: Dilma

texts.en:
Dilma A. owns and operates a a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 38 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Dilma has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Dilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Dilma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

In 2006, Lunita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from GDMPC, Lunita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her sari-sari store. This will be Lunita's fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 50 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y comprometida con el progreso D. su familia, vive en su casa propia y su anhelo es que mantener su hogar tan unido como siempre. Se dedica en la administración D. dos autos, los cuales alquila a algunos transportistas D. pasajeros para que trabajen por el día en rutas cercanas al distrito donD. ella vive. Lleva 5 años en esta labor, por lo tanto sabe seleccionar muy cautelosamente a las personas que trabajan con sus autos. Lo bueno D. su trabajo es que no tiene que realizar ninguna actividad, sólo estar pendiente D. las rutas D. los carros, pero considera que el abuso D. los policías D. transito perjudican el normal funcionamiento D. sus vehículos y trata D. lidiar con ellos continuamente. Para un futuro cercano desea adquirir un carro adicional para incrementar sus ingresos e invertirlo en la educación D. sus hijas.
Este es su catorceavo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, por lo que se compromete a seguir trabajando responsablemente en sus pagos junto a su banco comunal, donD. la consideran como una D. las líderes del grupo. Con los mil soles solicitados invertirá en la reparación D. las fallas mecánicas que presentan  sus vehículos.
texts.en:
Bertha is 50 years old. She is a hard-working woman who is committed to the progress of her family. She lives in her own house, and her wish is to keep her home as united as always. She manages two cars which she rents out to several passenger carriers so that they can work during the day in routes near the district where she lives. She has been working in this field for 5 years, for this reason she knows how to cautiously select the people who work with her cars. The good thing about her job is that she does not have to perform any activity, only to pay attention to the car routes, but she thinks that the abuse of the transit police is detrimental to the normal functioning of her vehicles and she tries to fight with them constantly. In the near future she would like to purchase an additional car to increase her income and to invest it in her children's education. This is her fourteenth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she promises to continue to work responsibly to make her payments, together with her communal bank, where she is considered to be a leader of the group. The thousand soles requested will be invested in repairing her vehicles' mechanical problems.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her cars

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 50 años, es una dulce maestra y madre de tres hijas, vive en su casa propia, lugar donde anhela construir sus más ansiados sueños. Ella es docente de profesión y anteriormente trabajaba brindando asesoría y nivelaciones para los escolares de su localidad. Con el paso del tiempo sus ingresos como maestra particular se incrementaron y le resultaba más rentable trabajar en casa que salir a otro distrito para trabajar en una escuela particular. Es así que hace cinco años  realizó todos los trámites y gestiones para abrir un centro educativo en su misma casa y gracias al apoyo de dos colegas inició las clases. Lo que le gusta a Elsa de su trabajo es educar a los niños, pues son muy dóciles en su  formación, sin embargo por el reducido espacio que tiene debe compartir ambientes de clases con los demás grados. Elsa sabe muy bien que para lograr sus metas requiere de mucha paciencia y constancia en su trabajo, por ello espera que se realice muy pronto la meta de terminar la construcción de su institución.
Este es su catorceavo préstamo en Microfinanzas PRISMA y está convencida que para seguir formando parte de su banco comunal sus pagos deben ser puntuales, por ello, junto a sus compañeras tratan de cumplir con las cuotas en las fechas programadas. Con los mil soles solicitados invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción para avanzar la ambientación de las aulas de clases.

loans.use: Compra de materiales de construcción

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny tiene 36 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus tres hijas, quienes al igual que ella, extrañan a su padre que tuvo que salir fuera del país en busca  de un trabajo mejor. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a capacitarse en repostería y gracias a los cursos que llevó hoy prepara los pasteles y tortas más solicitados en su localidad, pues satisfacen el exigente paladar de sus clientes. Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es la preparación de los bocaditos, pues comparte el trabajo  con su hija mayor, quien apoya a su madre en sus horas libres, disfrutando momentos gratos junto a ella. Sin embargo, lo más difícil es tener que trasladar los pedidos a lugares lejanos, pero esto es retribuido al ver los rostros  de satisfacción de las personas al degustar sus bocadillos, compensando así las arduas horas de trabajo. Sus planes a futuro son de abrir una cafetería-pastelería, un lugar de descanso donde las personas puedan sentirse cómodas y endulcen su vida con algunos bocaditos.
Este es su primer crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y está dispuesta a ser puntual con sus pagos, ya que desea seguir contando con futuros préstamos para mejorar su negocio. Con los dos mil soles que solicita comprará los ingredientes necesarios para elaborar mayor cantidad de postres y bocaditos.

loans.use: Compra de ingredientes para sus bocaditos y pasteles

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 54 años, es una mujer muy optimista y trabajadora, vive en compañía de su hija menor, quien es su mayor tesoro y tiene el deseo de brindarle un hogar lleno de amor y tranquilidad. El pequeño comedor que está ubicado en la plaza de su localidad, lugar donde sus clientes acuden con la intención de degustar la deliciosa sazón que tiene María para preparar los diversos platillos del día, los cuales también lleva a las diversas obras de construcción donde tiene pensionistas que contrataron sus servicios. Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es degustar de la variedad de platillos que prepara, ya que siempre se caracterizó por ser una cocinera muy exigente y de buen paladar. Sin embargo, en algunas oportunidades tuvo que lidiar con el incremento de precios de los productos, pero su buena capacidad de economizar le ayudó a salir airosa de estos críticos momentos. Por ese motivo y en base a todo el esfuerzo que realiza, María espera conseguir el capital necesario para adquirir un local apropiado donde pueda abrir un restaurante con todas las comodidades para sus comensales. 
Este es su primer crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y desde ahora trabaja con ahínco para ser cumplida y comprometida con el desarrollo del banco comunal del cual forma parte. Con los setecientos soles solicitados comprará utensilios de cocina y el menaje necesario para atender a más personas e incrementar sus ganancias y ahorros.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old, and is a very optimistic and hard-working woman. She lives with her youngest daughter, who is her greatest treasure, and she wishes to offer her a home full of love and peace. The small cafeteria that is located in the plaza of her town is a place where her customers come to taste the delicious seasonings that María uses to prepare the different dishes of the day. They also run different construction projects where they have residents who hire her services.

The thing that she enjoys the most of her work is to sample the variety of plates that she prepares, because she has always been known as a very demanding cook with a good palate. However, on some occasions, she had to fight with the increase of the prices of the products, but her good ability to economize helped her to come out of these critical moments gracefully. For this reason, and based on all of the hard work she´s done, María hopes to get the necessary capital to purchase her own place where she can open a restaurant with all of the comforts for her diners.

This is her first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and she now eagerly works to be accomplished and committed to the development of the community bank which she is part of. With the 700 soles requested, she will buy kitchen utensils and the necessary goods to serve more people and increase her profits and savings.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy utensils and kitchen goods

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 35 años, es una mujer que muestra gran optimismo por realizar nuevas actividades. Vive en su casa propia y sus más ansiados deseos están basados en el bienestar de su familia conformada por su pareja y su hijo de tan sólo cinco años. Se dedica a recolectar gran cantidad de piedras de diversos colores y formas, para luego enviarlas a Argentina donde vive su hermana, quien se encarga de convertir las piedras en preciosas joyas. Para esta labor, Maritza se contacta con diversas personas de otras ciudades, sobre todo de la selva del país, donde se encuentran las más extraordinarias colecciones. Este negocio lo viene realizando hace 5 años y lo que más le gusta es relacionarse con personas de otras ciudades, quienes comparten su pasión por la colección de piedras de exportación. Pero considera que lo difícil es trasladar la mercadería a la capital, pues son muy costosas y pesadas, por lo cual requiere el apoyo de su pareja en algunas ocasiones. Para el futuro, Maritza anhela viajar a otros países y contactarse con empresarios dedicados a la producción de joyería.
Este es su catorceavo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, donde siempre ha mostrado compromiso con su banco comunal, donde destaca por su entusiasmo. Con los mil doscientos soles solicitados planea comprar la mercadería que tiene pendiente por entregar, para así no interrumpir el habitual proceso de su negocio.
texts.en:
Maritza is 35 years old and is a woman that shows great optimism for carrying out new activities. She lives in her own house and her greatest desires are based on the well-being of her family, which consists of her partner and her son who is only five years old. She makes a living by gathering a large quantity of stones of diverse colors and shapes, to later send them to her sister, who lives in Argentina and is in charge of converting the stones into precious jewels. For this task, Maritza is in contact with various people from other cities, above all from the country's jungle, where the most extraordinary collections are found. She has been doing this business for 5 years and the thing that she likes most is being connected to people from other cities, who share her passion for collecting stones for exportation. However, she considers the most difficult part transferring the merchandise to the capital, because they are very expensive and heavy, and therefore requires the support of her partner on some occasions. In the future, Maritza hopes to travel to other countries and make contacts with entrepreneurs who work in the production of jewelry. This is Maritza's fourteenth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, where she has always shown commitment to her communal bank and stands out for her enthusiasm. With the requested 1,200 soles, she plans to purchase the pending merchandise that has yet to be delivered, in order to not interrupt the habitual process of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise.

loans.name: Maranatha Group

texts.es: Trece miembros deciden formar la asociación “Maranatha”, la mayoría tiene familias numerosas, así que se vieron en la necesidad de tener un negocio propio que les permita obtener ingresos para solventar la economía de sus hogares. Este grupo trabaja hace tres años aproximadamente junto a la institución, se reúne en el centro focal V. Exaltación, actualmente su presidenta es Natividad Q. ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de dulces artesanales,  otras de las socias tienen distintos negocios, por ejemplo, Olga vende cosméticos, Maria vende medias, Panfila  ofrece servicio de llamadas  locales y a larga distancia, Teresa tiene una tienda y Juan José  ofrece servicio de transporte publico. La asociación Maranatha necesita comprar insumos, y  mercadería para reactivar sus negocios, esto les permitirá obtener ingresos para ofrecer mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
Thirteen members decided to form the Maranatha Association. The majority have large families and they saw the necessity of having their own businesses, permitting them to obtain incomes to meet the financial needs of home. The group has worked with their micro-finance institution for 3 years, and they meet in the bank's center in V. Exaltation.

Presently, their president is Natividad, who makes and sells artisan sweets. Other members have distinct businesses; for example, Olga sells cosmetics, Maria sells hosiery, Panfila offers local and long distance phone services, Teresa has a store, and Juan Jose offers public transportation services.

The Maranatha Association needs to buy supplies, and merchandise to reactivate their businesses. This will permit them to obtain better incomes and offer a higher standard of living for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SUPPLIES OR MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is from the town of Baliangao. She is 49 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children.

Susana owns and operates a fishing business. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Susana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC.

Susana is requesting a new loan of 45,000 PHP which will be used to build a new house. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy optimista y dulce como madre, sus hijos Gianmarco y Sandra son su mayor tesoro y trata de ofrecerles una vida plena y feliz. Su tienda de abarrotes se encuentra en uno de los mercados de su localidad y es la más concurrida porque su buen ánimo y trato hicieron que María se gane la preferencia de sus clientes. A ella le agrada mantener conversaciones con sus clientes, quienes aprovechan el momento de realizar sus compras para solicitarle algunos consejos y ella está muy agradecida por la confianza que le brindan. Sin embargo, lo difícil es tener que lidiar con el aumento del costo de los productos, pues su interés es dar a sus clientes productos de calidad a un precio accesible. Sus planes a futuro son de implementar su negocio con productos novedosos.
Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con Microfinanzas PRISMA, por lo que se siente muy comprometida con su banco comunal y está dispuesta a trabajar en equipo con las demás integrantes, quienes al igual que ella, son nuevas en el grupo. Con los setecientos soles que solicita comprará mercadería suficiente para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
María is 41 years old. She is a very optimistic and sweet woman who is the mother of two children, Gianmarco and Sandra. Her children are her biggest treasure, and she tries to provide them with a life that is fulfilling and happy. María’s grocery store is situated in one of the markets in her area, and her store is the busiest in the neighborhood because her enthusiasm and service have earned her the loyalty of her customers. She likes having conversations with her customers, who use the occasion of shopping to ask María for advice, and she in turn appreciates the confidence that they have in her. However, it is difficult having to deal with the increased cost of products, since María wants to provide her customers with quality products for an affordable price. Her plan for the future is to stock her business with new products. This is María’s first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she feels very much involved with her communal bank and is ready to work in a team with the other members, who, like her, are new to the group. She will use the 700 soles she is requesting to purchase enough merchandise to satisfy the demand of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her merchandise

loans.name: Oswalda

texts.es:
Oswalda tiene 46 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y amigable, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja y sus dos hijos por quienes tiene el deseo de progresar. Desde que comienza el día, la tienda de Oswalda abre las puertas para atender la demanda de las madres de familia de su barrio, por lo que procura ofrecer productos frescos y de calidad. Lo que más le agrada de su negocio son las horas que pasa dialogando con sus clientes y entablando lazos de amistad, quienes no dudan en retornar por el buen trato que reciben. Sin embargo, las doce horas continuas atendiendo su tienda son pesadas, sobre todo los fines de semana cuando hay mayor venta de bebidas. Hace diez años que tiene este negocio y ahora ha empezado a elaborar chompas para exportación, con lo que obtiene dinero adicional para incrementar su capital, pues Oswalda se proyecta para ampliar su tienda en un futuro cercano.
Este es su séptimo crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y está segura de seguir formando parte de su banco comunal, pues siempre fue una persona muy puntual en sus pagos y es considerada como una de las socias más colaboradoras. Con los mil quinientos soles solicitados comprará mercadería para surtir su bodega con productos nuevos.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Su espíritu emprendedor siempre caracterizó a Rocío, quien ha trabajado arduamente a lo largo de su vida por el bienestar de su familia. Tiene 10 años de experiencia brindando servicios de costura y desde hace 5 años viene trabajando para una prestigiosa empresa que confecciona carteras para damas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es diseñar y combinar los colores en las carteras, teniendo como base la moda de la temporada. Sin embargo, considera que lo más difícil es vender y distribuir la mercadería en lugares estratégicos de acuerdo a la demanda del mercado. Para el futuro, Rocío espera modificar los ambientes de su domicilio e instalar una tienda de abarrotes, con la finalidad de contar con ingresos adicionales, puesto que sus hijos pronto cursarán estudios superiores y necesitará de mayores recursos.
Este es su cuarto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y está dispuesta a seguir formando parte de su banco comunal, en el cual se inició junto a tres amigas quienes trabajan comprometidamente por el progreso del grupo. Con los mil soles solicitados comprará lo necesario para adecuar un espacio de su casa para la implementación de su tienda de comestibles.

loans.use: Inversión para su nueva bodega

loans.name: Romy

texts.es:
Romy tiene 45 años, es una mujer que desde muy joven luchó por realizar sus sueños, los cuales con trabajo y dedicación fue cumpliendo poco a poco. Actualmente vive en su casa propia junto a la familia que formó con Félix, su pareja, con quien tuvo dos hijos. Ella es enfermera y su vocación de servicio le abrió las puertas para trabajar en lugares muy carentes de atención médica, donde brindó sus servicios por diez años. Ahora trabaja en su casa donde abrió una farmacia y un centro de salud, siendo sus vecinos los más beneficiados. Lo que motiva a Romy es aportar para el bienestar de los habitantes de su localidad, quienes confían en sus atenciones y sugerencias de prevención. En los 3 años que viene atendiendo en su farmacia ha tenido que estar al servicio de las personas las 24 horas al día, lo cual es lo más difícil de tener un centro de atención en su casa. Para el futuro Romy desea incrementar su farmacia con medicamentos esenciales, de la misma forma ambientar su casa con espacios adecuados para una atención más cómoda de sus pacientes.
Este es su cuarto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y viene trabajando con un alto grado de compromiso en su banco comunal donde se siente muy bien. Con los mil soles de crédito solicitados comprará algunos medicamentos para implementar su farmacia.
texts.en:
Romy is 45 years old. She started working towards achieving her dreams when she was very young and has made progress toward them through her hard work and dedication. She has her own home, which she shares with Felix and the family they have made together. They have two children. She is a nurse and her vocation of service has opened doors for her to be able to work in areas very much in need of medical care, where she offered her services for ten years. She now runs a pharmacy and health center from her home, where her neighbors have benefitted very much. What motivates Romy is contributing to the well being of the people in her local area, who trust in her attention and advice on preventive care. In the three years that she has run her pharmacy, she has had to be able to provide for people 24-hours a day, which is the most difficult part of running a health care center from her home. Romy wants to be able to stock her pharmacy with essential medicines and create more space in her home in order to be able to offer her patients a more comfortable environment. This will be the fourth loan she has gotten through "Microfinanzas PRISMA" to which she is highly dedicated and feels comfortable with. She will use the money from this loan of "1000 Soles" ($350 US) to buy medicines to stock her pharmacy.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medicines to Stock Her Pharmacy

loans.name: Yanetd

texts.es:
Yanetd tiene 36 años, es una mujer muy alegre, vive en su casa propia y su más ansiado deseo es tener una buena posición económica para educar a su hija. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos, lo cual realiza a domicilio y en las calles, por lo que en ocasiones aprovecha las ferias de su ciudad para ofrecer los productos que tiene en stock. Pero generalmente, Yanetd vende a través de los catálogos, siendo sus vecinas y familiares los clientes que con más frecuencia la visitan, ya que por su gran sentido del humor sabe ganarse el cariño de las personas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la amistad que hace con sus clientas, pues en sus horas de visita siempre tiene un tiempo para dialogar con ellas. En estos cuatro años como promotora de ventas considera que lo más difícil es salir a las calles y realizar las cobranzas, debido a que algunas clientas se retrasan en sus pagos perjudicando su capital de trabajo. Para el futuro desea abrir una tienda de cosméticos en su casa, la cual ya es conocida por sus clientes, solo requiere de un espacio adecuado y de exhibidores para sus productos.
Este es su tercer crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y el tiempo que lleva siendo parte de un banco comunal la ha ayudado a mejorar sus relaciones interpersonales. Con los mil soles de crédito que solicita comprará los productos que están de oferta en los catálogos con el fin de contar con productos en stock.
texts.en:
Yanetd is 36 years old, and a very happy woman. She lives in her own home and her greatest wish is to be in a financial position to educate her daughter. Her business is the sale of cosmetics out of her home and as a street vendor. She offers her stock on hand for sale at town fairs; however, in general Yanetd deals in catalog sales. The customers that visit her most frequently are her neighbors and family members, because her great sense of humor has earned her their love. What she likes best about her job is the friendship that she has with her clients, and she always takes time to visit when they come calling. In the four years she has been in sales what has been most difficult is taking to the streets to collect payments, because some customers are behind on their payments and that is impacting her working capital. In the future she would like to open a cosmetics shop in her home because it is a location that is already familiar to her customers. She is just in need of adequate space and display cases for her products. This is Yanetd's third loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and membership in a community bank has helped her to improve her interpersonal relationships. With the 1000 Peruvian soles that she is requesting, Yanetd will buy products for sale in the catalogs in order to have more stock on hand.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Rodita

texts.en:
Rodita R. is 45 years old and married to a tri-bike (a bicycle with sidecar attached to its body) driver, Angelo R.. She has four children who range in age from 4 to 25 years old. Her eldest child is a college undergraduate and now works as a supply officer for the newest and the biggest shopping mall in the province of Antique. It was not so long ago that Rodita was receiving financial assistance from her eldest child, since her businesses started just recently. Her 21-year-old second child is a high school undergraduate and is unemployed. Therefore, three of Rodita’s children are dependent on her and her husband for financial support, with two children still studying in elementary school and preschool.

Rodita’s membership in ASHI, beginning in 2001, has been a great opportunity for her to improve the economy of her family. Through ASHI, she has been able to access credit which has allowed her to enact her thoughts and skill in running her own business. With her membership and previous loans, she has started a food vending business, a pig raising business, and a tri-bike for public transportation business. The first two businesses are managed by Rodita herself. The tri-bike business is managed by her husband.

In the villages of the municipality of Hamtic, where Rodita and her family live, tri-bike is the most common means of transportation. However, this can only serve for short distance travel. For far and hilly places, tricycle (a motorcycle with sidecar attached to its body) is the municipality's other means of transportation. A tricycle is much more expensive than a tri-bike; however, owners make a bigger income. With Rodita’s present loan, she will be purchasing a tricycle for a tricycle-for-hire business to be managed by her husband. She plans to hire a driver for her tri-bike.

loans.use: To purchase a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar)

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
60-year-old Juliana C. is requesting a loan through ASHI, which will be used to enhance her livestock-raising business. She wants a larger amount of capital to be able to purchase cattle, hogs/pigs, and ducks. She started this kind of business in 1990, to augment the income her farm-laborer husband earns. With a child sent to school until college, Juliana and her husband’s sporadic income is insufficient to grow their business at the same time.

Starting her business with a small variety of livestock to raise and sell after a period of time, Juliana became a member of ASHI in 2001. Since she has been able to get loans, their capacity for raising more livestock has increased. Her husband has been supporting her and has been a partner in running the business. With the profit Juliana is making through her business, she has been able to send her only 18-year-old child to college, and she wishes that her business would grow more to be able to support his education through graduation.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase cattle and hogs for fattening

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
32-year-old Jennifer C. has three children ages two, six, and seven years old. Her husband is a tri- bike (bicycle with sidecar attached to its body) driver and has been a great partner of her not as a husband and father to her children but in the business as well.

When Jennifer joined ASHI in 2004, she had an opportunity to request for a loan. From then and there, she was able to start having a tri- bike for public transport business managed by her husband.  Eventually, she had purchase three tri-bikes and her business had generated employment. Aside from her husband, Jennifer employed two more drivers for her business. 

Entering the villages of the municipality of Hamtic where Jennifer and her family live, tri- bike is the most common means of transportation for short distances. This kind of business has been a great provider of income to Jennifer and the rest of her employees. 

With the loan Jennifer is requesting now, she wanted to put up a business to be run by her while looking after the needs of her family at home. In their wide verdant plane sloped backyard, she wished to build a pig pen for a hog fattening business and purchase a cattle for her cattle fattening business. With these kind of business, profit is as much double the amount of its capital after a period of time fattening hogs (pigs) and cattle.

loans.use: Will be used as an additional capital for a hog and cattle fattening business.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 22 años, desde muy niño mostró gran cariño por la familia y desde que se casó trata de esforzarse para ser un buen padre y compañero. Vive en la casa de sus padres donde le brindaron una pequeña habitación para él y su esposa. Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en un motocarro, para esto, se levanta muy temprano para iniciar sus actividades a las seis de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche, horario que es rotativo, pues en ocasiones tiene que trabajar por las noches en compañía de su padre. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo es que puede relacionarse con muchas personas en el transcurso de las horas de viaje y en los ocho años que lleva ofreciendo sus servicios considera que lo más difícil es manejar cuando hay mucho tráfico, lo cual altera la tranquilidad de sus pasajeros quienes exigen llegar temprano a su destino. Sus planes a futuro son de comprar un carro para mejorar sus ingresos económicos y alquilar la moto que tiene a sus vecinos chóferes.
Este en su quinto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y está decidido a trabajar con la misma responsabilidad y compromiso como lo hizo hasta hoy. Los dos mil quinientos soles que solicita los invertirá en el arreglo de su moto, pues tiene que pasar revisiones técnicas para su normal funcionamiento.

loans.use: Reparación de su motocarro

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 45 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy alegre, vive con su pareja y sus dos hijas a quienes les trata de brindar una educación de calidad para que sean buenos profesionales a futuro. Gracias a la venta de cosméticos pudo incrementar los ingresos económicos que percibe como docente. Ella  se inició como promotora de ventas de cosméticos hace cinco años y desde entonces se hizo conocida en la institución educativa donde trabaja, ya que sus clientes son sus compañeros de trabajo, quienes le hacen numerosos pedidos. Vender es lo que más le agrada a Martha, pues ayuda a las personas a mejorar su imagen, pero lo difícil es realizar las cobranzas cada quincena, pues tiene que estar pendiente de sus clientes con el fin de no perjudicar su capital de trabajo. Sus planes a futuro son de abrir un espacio de belleza dentro de su casa, donde pueda ofrecer sus productos y adicionalmente brindar servicios de decoración, pues le gusta las manualidades y las decoraciones. 
Este es su quinto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y está muy comprometida con su banco comunal, donde es conocida como una persona responsable y solidaria. Los dos mil soles que ahora solicita los invertirá en la compra de más productos de belleza con la finalidad de tenerlos en stock.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Rossi

texts.es:
Rossi tiene 36 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia situada en la parte alta de su distrito. Su dedicación por el bienestar de su familia es notable, debido al gran amor que les tiene. Ella se dedica a prestar servicios de limpieza y preparación de alimentos en diversos hogares por las mañanas, luego retorna a casa para atender su propio hogar. Lleva 10 años trabajando y lo que más le agrada de su actividad  es conocer diversos lugares de su ciudad y relacionarse con personas adineradas, quienes le han brindado mucho apoyo en momentos difíciles. Rossi sabe que aunque le agrada prestar sus servicios algún día no tendrá las condiciones físicas para continuar haciéndolo, por ello se esfuerza en mejorar sus condiciones económicas. Para un futuro no muy lejano anhela tener un negocio de venta de ropa, pues le agrada vender en sus ratos libres y su hermana tiene el deseo de apoyarla brindándole un espacio en su puesto del mercado.
Este es su cuarto crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA, Rossi desea seguir trabajando responsablemente en su banco comunal, ya que siempre se caracterizó por ser muy cumplida con sus pagos. Con los dos mil quinientos soles de crédito comprará mercadería para iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Rossi is 36 years old. She is very hardworking, and lives in her own house in the upper part of her district. Rossi is dedicated to the well-being of her family because of her great love for them.

Rossi’s business is housecleaning and food preparation, which she does in various homes in the mornings. After work, she returns home to care for her own home. She has been doing this work for 10 years and the thing she appreciates most about it has been getting to know other parts of the city and building relationships with her more affluent clients, who have offered her much support in difficult times.

Although Rossi enjoys her work, she knows that she will someday not be in the physical condition to continue with it. For this reason, she would like to start a clothing sales business that she could pursue in her spare time. Her sister has offered her space for the business at her market stall.

This is Rossi’s fourth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She would like to continue working with this communal bank where she has always been responsible with her payments. With this loan of 2500 soles, she will buy merchandise to begin her clothing sales business.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana tiene 49 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y desea que su familia mejore sus condiciones de vida. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos, ella considera que en los diez años que tiene como promotora de ventas han mejorado sus ingresos económicos debido a la diversidad de líneas de belleza a las que se integró para ofrecer a las personas variedad de productos con precios accesibles. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son los regalos que le otorgan por la cantidad de ventas que tiene cada quincena, pero lo difícil está en realizar las cobranzas a sus clientas para no retrazarse en sus pagos, pues de esto depende la entrega de sus premios. Para un futuro cercano, Susana desea tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos de belleza junto a otros objetos para el hogar.  
Con los dos mil soles de crédito que solicita invertirá en la compra de más productos que estén en oferta para incrementar su stock.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Mirembe's Group

texts.en: N. Mirembe is a 25 year old and a business lady selling first class clothes and shoes from Kiyindi. She is a married lady with three children aged between 8 years to 1 month as she takes care of her late sister’s children. At the start of her business, she was only into selling clothes but included shoes for expansion and more earnings. She is successful because of her loans that increase capital and profitability plus having quality clothes as well as her friendly and good customer care skills. She has a dream of growing much bigger to supply to the rest of the traders as well as building a residential house for them. She is such a hard working lady who needs a loan to help recapitalize her business for a steady supply.

loans.use: Buying more clothes and shoes for business expansion.

loans.name: Tserendorj

texts.en: Tserendorj is a 39 year old man living with his wife and 4 year-old child in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. He used to work as a guard at the local market Hasu. In 2003, he made the decision to start his own  business making wooden furniture. At first, his working capital was 150 000 tugrug (~105 USD), but it soon reached  800 000 tugrug (~560 USD).  Tserendorj has gained a lot of experience and knowledge as a business owner over the years and got his regular customers. As his business has grown steadily, thus enabled him to buy own house and also a small truck to transport raw material and deliver goods to his customers. He is requesting a 800 000 tugrug (~560 USD) loan to buy more tools and wood for his furniture making business.

loans.use: to buy more tools and wood for his furniture making business.

loans.name: Idertsog

texts.en: Idertsog is a 39-year-old man who lives with his wife and three children in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. Idertsog began his business in 2001 by selling a variety of consumer goods imported from China. This business started with a working capital of 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD). As his sales increased, so did his need for selling space. Therefore, in 2005, he bought a shipping container in which to sell his products and a truck to transport his products. Now his working capital is approximately 6,000,000 tugrug (~4200 USD). This business is the only source of earnings for him and his family, and he is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug (~2800 USD) loan so that he may purchase more supplies and products for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies and products for his business

loans.name: Densmaa

texts.en: Densmaa is a 50 year old woman who lives with her husband and son in the Arkahngai province of Mongolia. Her son attends university and her husband helps her with her business. Densmaa works hard to ensure the happiness of her only child and family. She started her food trading business in 1995 in a small shop. At that time, the working capital was 80 000 tugrug (~56 USD). Today, the working capital has reached 600 000 tugrug (~420 USD) .  As her business has grown, she has earned enough money to buy a new house for her family. She says "Having our own home is very nice and our life becoming happier than ever". She is requesting  a 1 000 000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan to purchase more products in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products

loans.name: Munkhjargal

texts.en: Muhkhjargal B. is a 26 year old young lady who  lives with her husband in the Arkahngai province of Mongolia. Her husband is a goat herder and they do not have any children yet because they want to save money in order to provide for the family. She started her clothing sales business in 2007 by renting a small stall in the Central market to sell a variety of products that have been imported from China.  At first, the working capital was 500 000 turgug (~350 USD) but soon grew to over 1 200 000 tugrug (~800 USD). Today, she focuses on her dream of owning her own small shop in the future. She is requesting a  1 500 000 tugrug (~1050 USD) loan to purchase more men and women apparel for her growing store.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes J. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs in the resturant and is requesting a loan to purchase more chairs and tables in the resturant for better acommodation. 

 Agnes is 23 years old and is Married with a husband that is a fire brigador. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the floor of her resturant.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more chairs and tables in her resturant

loans.name: Akongo

texts.en: Akongo M. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to open up a backery.  Akongo is 46 years old and is Married with a husband that is a peasant . She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for children BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en:
B. Aisha, 49, is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She received a loan previously that she used so well and now needs another. She is a businesswoman with a restaurant that she has owned for a long time.

Aisha is a widow with five children aged 13 to 30 years and she also takes care of six dependents. She is grateful that at least she does not have to pay fees for her primary-school-going children but pays for those in higher institutions.

Aisha’s business is doing well because of the way she handles her customers and this has even won her more customers. She still has a dream of building her own house that can accommodate her restaurant. She needs a loan to help buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en: Kaku F. is currently in the business of alcohol distillation and selling of local alcohol and is requesting a loan to purchase more brewing materials. Kaku is 28 years old and is widowed. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy food for her family. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more brewing materials

loans.name: Miguel Juliao

texts.pt:
Miguel Juliao M. nasceu em Inhambane tem 27 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é pai de dois filhos o primeiro de 5 anos e um recém nascido de apenas 1 mês. para alem dos seus filhos não responsabiliza se por ninguém e consegue poupar por mês 500.00MT.

Miguel sai de inhambane para Namaacha na companhia do seu tio e consegue um emprego no mesmo distrito. Miguel trabalha como guarda a mais de 9 anos, cuidando e vivendo em casa do seu patrão ganhando mensalmente 3.500.00MT.

Na tentativa de aumentar a renda familiar, com o fundo que havia colectado, ele inicia com a criação de pintos na capoeira que foi cedida pelo patrão, mas devido à reabilitação das mesmas teve que parar e dar inicia de uma outra actividade (venda de roupas adquiridas na áfrica do sul nomeadamente mantas, calças, blusas e alguns utensílios domésticos), mas como aproxima se o verão tem tido muitas encomendas.

Este e o terceiro empréstimo de Miguel na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva no valor de 10.000,00mt para compra e venda de roupa. Vai fazer pela primeira vez. O primeiro de 8.000.00MT foi usado para comprar pintos e ração para o negocio de criação de frangos, o segundo de 10.000.00MT para aumentar o volume de criação de frangos. 
Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo para concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Miguel Juliao M. was born in Inhambane and he's 27 years old. He is married and has two children, a 5 year old and a newborn. Besides his children, he is not responsible for anyone else and is able to save 500.00MT every month. Miguel has been working as a security guard for the past 9 years, and lives at his employers house. He makes 3.500.00MT per month. In the attempt of increase the family's income, he used his savings to start raising chicken at the piece of land given him by his boss, but while the land was being reabilitated, he had to put his chicken business on hold and started selling clothes from South Africa, like pants and shirts, as well as kitchen utensils. With summer coming up, Miguel has been getting a lot of orders. This is his third loan with Hluvuku and the first with Kiva, in the amount of $375, to buy more inventory for his clothing business. The two first loans were used to start his chicken business. He is confident that he will be able to pay it back soon, and then ask for another one to finish building his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Amelia De Jesus

texts.pt:
Amélia nasceu em Inhambane tem 30 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é mãe de dois filhos o primeiro de 7 e o segundo de 4 anos o mais velho é que vai a escola.Estudou ate 12 classe. Responsabiliza se pela sua mãe enviando lhe 1.000.00MT ao mês, e consegue poupar 500.00MT.

Amélia sai de Inhambane quando seu pai é transferido para trabalhar em Namaacha uma vila na fronteira de Swazilândia. Apos sua chegada ela inicia com os estudos e consegue fazer o curso de professorado durante 2 anos (tempo regular) foi afecta em Goba uma Localidade que dista 50 km da vila de Namaacha, trabalha das 7h às 12h auferindo 7.557, 00mt mensalmente. 

Aproxima se ao um banco comercial que tambem opera neste distrito (BIM) solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00MT para compra de um terreno, reembolsou sem  problema, apenas reclamou as modalidades de pagamento que não são compactiveis com o seu desejo. Em conversa com seus colegas soube da existência da Hkluvuku e aproxima se solicitando um empréstimo para dar inicio da sua obra, conta com ajuda do seu esposo, este que também é Professor.

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Amélia na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva no valor de 15.000,00MT para compra de material de construção (cimento, areia e outros). O primeiro de 6.000.00MT foi usado para comprar material de construção. O segundo de 8.000.00MT foi usado também na compra de material de construção. Está confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto. Tem como objectivo concluir a sua residência e dar continuidade dos seus estudos.
texts.en:
Amelia was born in Inhambane and she is 30 years old. She is married and has two children, a 7 year old who attends school and a 4 year old. She also takes her of her mother, sending her 1.000,00MT every month, and she's still able to save 500.00MT. Amelia left Inhambane when her father was transfered to work at a village in Namaacha. She then started her studies and was able to get a teaching credential in 2 years. She teaches in Goba, a village about 50km from Namaacha, from 7AM to 12-noon, and makes 7.557,00MT per month. She has previously been given a loan for 20.000,00MT (U$ 750) which she used to buy a piece of land, and she paid it on time. Later she borrowed 6.000,00MT and 8.000,00MT which she used to buy construction supplies to start building her house. She is now asking for a new loan to finish the construction with the help of her husband, who's also a teacher. This is her first loan with Kiva, and she's asking for 15.000,00MT (U$575) to buy construction supplies (cement, sand, etc.) She is confident she should have no problems paying the loan back before the due date. She dreams of finishing her house and going back to school to further her studies.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction supplies (concrete, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Lato

texts.en: Lato L. is currently in the business of distillation and selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to purchase more yeasts for brewing. Lato is 43 years old and was widowed when her husband was shot dead during the two decade war in Southern Sudan. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Lato hopes to be able to pay her children’s school fees. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more yeasts for brewing

loans.name: Beloclaide Enoque

texts.pt:
Beloclaide Enoque Macie B. tem 30 anos de idade estudou ate 10ª classe é solteiro pai de 1 filho de apenas 1 ano e meio. Responsabiliza se pela sua tia enviando lhe 500.00MT em cada três meses e consegue mensalmente poupar 1.000.00MT.

Quando sai de Gaza com seus pais para Vila de Namaacha na Fronteira de Suazilândia, inicia os estudos e faz a 10ª classse, mas teve que interromper quando engravida a sua namorada. Assim seu pai da lhe um fundo para iniciar o negocio de criação de frangos para conseguir sustentar a sua família. Anos depois arranja um emprego numa empresa de segurança privada. É funcionário permanente ha. mais de cinco anos trabalha em turnos auferindo 2.600 mensalmente. 

Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Beloclaide na Hluvuku e Kiva no valor de 8.000.00MT que será usado para aumentar o volume de criação (compra de pintos de 1 dia e ração para produção de frangos). Tem metido em média de 2caixasx100pintos em cada fase (15 em15 dias), pois ele tem vendido alternadamente para não perder a clientela. Gastando em cada fase um valor de 14.000.00MT obtendo de lucro um valor de 4.000.00MT quando vende a grosso para revendedores, e de 6.000.00MT quando vende por unidade a consumidores locais.

 Já teve com uma outra instituição de credito (Banco Novo) no valor de 4.000.00MT pagou com muito sucesso, esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir outro empréstimo para construção de dependências para aluguer uma vez que este serviço é muito solicitado pelos alunos e trabalhadores que vem de outros distritos.
texts.en:
Beloclaide Enoque Macie B. is 30 years old and he's the single father of a 1 year old boy. He also takes care of his aunt, sending her 500.00MT every month, and he's still able to save 1.000,00MT. He left Gaza with his parents and moved to the village of Namaacha, where he had to drop school on 10th grade when he got his girlfriend pregnant. His father gave him money to start his own chicken raising business so he could support his family. A few years later he got a job as a security guard, where he's been working for the past 5 years and makes 2.600,00MT per month. This is Beloclaide's first loan with Kiva in the amount of 8.000,00MT (U$ 300) which he is using to buy more chicks and ration to feed them, so he can grow his business. He is confident that he will pay it back before the due date, and he is planning on taking another loan later on in order to build rooms to rent to students and workers that come to his town from other districts.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 1 day old chicks and ration to feed them

loans.name: Crimilde Geraldina

texts.pt:
Crimilde Geraldina M. nasceu em Magude (Maputo) tem 31 anos de idade é separada mãe de 2 filhos. A primeira de 11 anos e o segundo de 7 todos vão à escola, responsabiliza se pela sua mãe enviando lhe 500.00MT mensalmente.


 Crimilde após concluir a 7ª classe muda de residência da sua terra natal para a Vila de Namaacha na Fronteira de Suazilândia, esta fica grávida do seu primeiro filho logo junta se com o seu esposo uma vez que este não trabalha, crimilde teve que fazer o curso de professorado durante 3 anos (tempo regular) para conseguir sustentar seus filhos. Apos a conclusão é afecta no mesmo distrito como professora do primeiro ciclo, é funcionaria permanente a mais de sete anos trabalhando das 7h as 12:30h auferindo 3.200.00MT mensalmente e não consegue poupar nada devido ao elevado custo de vida. Anos depois separa se do seu esposo, consecutivamente é cedida uma parte de terra na zona de expansão pelo seu patronato e inicia a sua obra com os dois primeiros empréstimos que obteve na hluvuku de 6.000.00MT e de 4.000.00MT. Hoje vive em sua própria casa ainda em acabamento.


Este é o terceiro empréstimo de crimilde na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva. O primeiro de 6.000.00MT foi usado para comprar material de construção, o segundo de 4.000.00MT também foi usado para compra de material e este terceiro de 8.000.00MT será usado para o mesmo fim. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir outro empréstimo para a construção de um murro de vedação na sua moradia.
texts.en:
Crimilde Geraldina M. was born in Magude (Maputo). She is 31, separated, and has 2 children. Her daughter is 11 yeas old and her son is 7. Both attend school. She also supports her mother, sending her 500.00MT monthly. After finishing 7th grade, Crimilde moved from her hometown to Vila de Namaacha on the border with Suaziland. She later became pregnant with her first child and got married. When he stopped working, Crimilde completed a degree in teaching going to school full time for 3 years in order to support her children. Once she finished she worked in the same state as an elementary school teacher. She has held a permanent teaching position for the past 7 years, working from 7am to 12:30pm, earning 3,200,00MT monthly. She is unable to save due to the high cost of living. Years later she separated from her husband. Around the same time she received a parcel of land from her employer in the suburbs and began building her home with the first two loans that she received from Hluvuku fo 6.000.00MT and 4.000.00MT. Today she lives in her own home which she is still finishing. This is Crimilde's third loan with Hluvuku and the first with Kiva. The first loan was for 6.000.00MT which she used to buy construction materials. The second loan for 4.000.00MT was also used to purchase materials and this third loan for 8.000.00MT will be used for the same thing. She is confident that she will pay off the loan before it is due and request another loan to build a wall around her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Fabric

texts.en:
Fabric S. currently sells various items like cooking oil, bags of salt etc at her shop and is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders in order for her to possibly purchase and stock more goods in her shop to sell.

She is 23, and is a married woman with four children and her children attend school. With the extra profits from her loan in future, she intends to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana W. is currently in the business of selling bread and tea in the restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock sugar and bread. Twenty-five years old and married to a soldier, Susanna has four children, all attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

texts.en: Opia M. is currently in the business of selling maize flour and is requesting a loan to stock more maize flour to sell.  Opia is 43 years old and is Widowed.   She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family's settlement BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.
