Adicionalmente, cuando llega la noche trabaja con un motocarro realizando transporte de pasajeros hasta las 12 de la noche. Con estas actividades, Celestino logró obtener las ganancias necesarias para educar a sus hijos, quienes ahora trabajan en otras ciudades y eso los llena de regocijo a él y su esposa.
Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que también ingresa a un banco comunal por invitación del presidente del grupo, ya que conoce que es un hombre muy responsable. Por su parte, Celestino hace compromisos de no defraudar tal confianza. El dinero que ahora solicita será invertido en la compra de dos llantas para su motocarro y de ese modo siga trabajando “para su viejita”, como él llama cariñosamente a su esposa.

loans.use: Compra de llantas para su motocarro

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David tiene 22 años, es un joven muy carismático, es el tercero de 8 hermanos y vive en la casa de sus padres. El año pasado acaba de graduarse como profesor y actualmente viene dictando clases en uno de los colegios de su pueblo. Adicionalmente, tiene un negocio propio, el cual consiste en la venta de productos de panadería, como: pan de molde, queques y en temporada navideña, el tradicional panetón, productos que ofrece de casa en casa a sus familiares y vecinos para un pago al contado o al crédito.  Por otro lado, los fines de semana David trabaja en sus cultivos de café, pues también le gusta mucho esta labor, ya que desde niño apoyaba a sus padres en las chacras. La temporada más rentable del café es en los meses de junio a agosto y con el dinero que obtiene apoya a sus padres y hermanos menores en sus gastos. El dinamismo de David es muy contagiante y motivador para sus vecinos y también incentiva a sus hermanos para realizar un trabajo colectivo, porque sus anhelos son de que toda su familia progrese.
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y ha demostrado ser un cliente muy responsable y bastante entendido en su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para sus cafetales y también incrementará la cantidad de sus productos de panadería.
texts.en:
David is 22 years old. He is a very charismatic young man. He is the third of eight siblings and lives in his parents house. Last year he graduated as a teacher, and he currently teaches classes in one of the high schools in his town. In addition, he has his own business, which consists of selling baked goods, like: bread, cakes and at Christmas time, the traditional Christmas cake. He offers these products from door to door to his family and neighbors for payment by cash or credit. In addition, on the weekend David works growing coffee. He also greatly enjoys this work as he has been helping his parents on their farm since he was a child. The most profitable season for coffee is in the months from June to August and with the money he obtains, he helps his parents and his younger siblings with their expenses. David's energy is very contagious and motivates his neighbors and encourages his siblings to work together because his aspirations are that his entire family progresses. This is his second loan with MFP and he has demonstrated himself to be a very responsible and knowledgeable client in his community bank. With the money he solicits, he will buy chemical fertilizers for his coffee and also increase the quantity of baked goods.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina V. - 54 years old - is a native of Ormoc, Leyte that has migrated to Metropolitan Manila. Her husband Narciso - 48 years old - is a welder. They have two children. Her family lives in a government subsidized housing facility in Pasay City.

Josefina manages a fleet of pedicabs (rickshaw) that run different routes in her community. Josefina also sells purified drinking water in large blue containers and uses a rickshaw to deliver them to households. She earns close to Php 7,000 a month combined, from these business activity.

Being a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative since 2004 has been a blessing for Josefina. With her profits, she has been able to purchase another pedicab unit, which she uses to deliver the purified drinking water. Josefina now needs a new loan in the amount of Php 11,000 to invest into a new venture of frozen meat products sales.

She is working hard to save money to help her husband establish his own welding shop.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To invest in a new business venture - frozen meat products sales

loans.name: Meljoy

texts.en: 26-year-old Meljoy C. is a mother of 2 children with her eldest as 7 years old. She has been married for 9 years. She is into Rice Farming. Her rice field is currently growing well but she admits an additional capital would really help in her produce. An abundant harvest is what she aims for. Her income will be helpful especially on her children’s school fees. It is her first time to join CEVI. She applied for a loan of Php6, 000. This loan will be used for farm financing.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
Dionisio es un hombre muy alegre de 49 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus 7 hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos aun vive con él. Desde que se casó, la siembra de arvejas y papas ha sido su actividad cotidiana, ya que gracias a estos cultivos pudo obtener los recursos para educar a sus hijos, quienes ahora, en su mayoría, viven y trabajan en la ciudad de Lima. Por ello, Dionisio se siente muy feliz de ser agricultor y lo que más le complace es que trabaja en compañía de su esposa, sin sentir cansancio. Su actividad inicia a las 6 de la mañana y culmina a las 5 de la tarde, dedicándose a quitar las hierbas, remover la tierra y regar los cultivos hasta que logren aflorar y producir un buen tamaño de arvejas, tal como en que se muestra en la foto, donde orgullosamente quiso posar.
Para Dionisio este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, siendo un socio muy puntual en sus cuotas, además de sentirse muy cómodo en su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando es para la compra de dos bolsas de arvejas (semilla) y fertilizantes químicos.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes y semilla

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe U. runs a sari-sari (general store) selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. in his community. He is 78 years old, widowed and has two adult children. He is from the village of Poblacion 1 Clarin Misamis Occidental. Felipe has been in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 20,000 pesos a month.

In 2006, Felipe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Felipe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 pesos from GDMPC. Felipe is requesting a new loan of 50,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 36th loan taken out by Felipe from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en: Rice farmer Nieves A. is 50 years old who lives in Agusan Del Sur. Pleased on her growing rice plants, she is encouraged to take extra care of her field. It is her first time to join a microfinance. She joined CEVI because like her fellow farmers in her town, she could use the financial assistance to fund her farm. She applied for Php6, 000. She will use the loan to purchase additional farm inputs. Nieves anticipates a plenteous harvest.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Viselyn

texts.en: A rice farmer in the town of Magsaysay, Veruela, Agusan Del Sur, Viselyn C. seeks additional financial support to help sustain her farm. She is 30 years old and has been the program they are offering, especially the low interest rates or borrowing and the savings policy. She applied for PHP6,000 to purchase farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm Financing.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar es un hombre muy responsable, tiene 34 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus dos hijos es su casa propia. Desde muy pequeño ayudaba en los cultivos de su padre, ganando así la experiencia para lograr producir en mayor cantidad las arvejas y papas. Actualmente trabaja junto a su esposa, empezando su labor a las 6 de la mañana, mientras que ella lo alcanza con el almuerzo y lo apoya en las labores. Cuando llega la época de cosecha, optan por contratar peones para alcanzar recolectar de 10 hasta 20 sacos de papa, los cuales ese mismo día, a las 7 de la noche, los llevan al mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde le pagan dependiendo la plaza, ya que en cuestión de minutos puede subir o bajar el precio. En el caso de las arvejas, es un producto muy rentable, porque de una sola siembra cosecha hasta tres veces, permitiéndole acumular mayores ganancias.
Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, con el dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos, además de semillas de arvejas.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes y semilla

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario R. is a 57-year-old widow who currently lives in a socialized government housing facility for the poor in Malibay, Pasay City.

Life has been hard for Rosario especially now as she is adjusting to her new environment since she and her siblings moved to their new house under government subsidy. But she stays strong and with her will, she has been able to re-establish her general store in the heart of the housing facility. She is now earning at least P7,000.00 a month and is quite optimistic that she can make the dream of having a grocery store in the community come true in the soonest possible time.

Rosario got to know the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2001.  She is now on her 17th loan cycle and has applied for a new loan in the amount of PHP11,000.00 so that she can expand her general store.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: business expansion.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
A sus 65 años, Elías trabaja arduamente en sus chacras, es casado y tiene 6 hijos. Sus labores agrícolas generalmente las realiza solo, pero durante los días de cosecha, sí necesita la ayuda de su esposa, con quien logra recolectar mayor cantidad de papas. Posteriormente, comercializan sus productos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde los venden a los comerciantes de verduras en menos de media hora, debido a la calidad de sus papas. A Elías no le preocupa mucho el precio del mercado, pues suele vender cada saco entre 30 y 50 soles, y aun cuando tiene un precio menor, logra ganancias, debido a la gran cantidad de producto que cosecha, lo cual compensa su inversión.
Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y durante este tiempo ha demostrado ser muy puntual en cada uno de sus pagos, además se siente muy bien en su banco comunal. El dinero ahora solicitado lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su próxima siembra de papa.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene tiene 47 años, es una mujer muy laboriosa, vive con su esposo. Su única hija vive y trabaja en otra ciudad. Se dedica a la siembra de papas en sus propias chacras y debido a la experiencia ganada en todos estos años ha logrado el dominio de las técnicas agrícolas. En consecuencia, junto a su pareja han conseguido que sus cultivos le sean muy rentables y con esas ganancias educaron a su hija en Lima (ciudad capital), pagando también su estadía y alimentación mientras estudiaba. Irene comercializa sus productos en el mercado de mayoristas de la ciudad, donde todos los miércoles por la tarde (en época de cosecha), vende las papas más grandes entre 30 y 50 soles el saco; las medianas, las guarda en su depósito, esperando que los otros compradores de la zona costeña la visiten. A Irene le gusta sembrar este tubérculo porque aunque sea de mucha inversión, siempre recupera y gana, cuyos ahorros viene reuniendo para comprar otros terrenos de su cultivo. 
Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete y aconseja a sus compañeros de grupo a seguir pagando puntualmente sus cuotas, siendo ella la tesorera de su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos y funguicidas para su próxima siembra de papas.
texts.en:
Irene is 47 years old, she is an industrious woman and lives with her husband. Her only daughter lives and works in another city. Irene works planting potatoes in her own farm and due to the experience gained over the years, she has mastered the necessary agricultural techniques. Consequently, working together with her spouse, they have managed to have profitable crops and have used their earnings to pay for their daughter’s education in Lima (capital city), including room and board. Irene sells her products in the city’s wholesale market, where every Wednesday afternoon (during the crop season) she sells the biggest potatoes for about 30 to 50 soles per sack; she keeps the medium-sized potatoes, hoping to sell them to other buyers visiting from coastal areas. Irene likes to plant this tuber because in spite of the high investment required, she always recoups it and makes a profit; she has been saving to buy more potato fields. This is her fifth loan with MFP, encouraging a personal commitment and advising her fellow group members to continue making payments on time, since she is also the treasurer of the community bank. She is thinking of investing her loan in buying chemical fertilizers and fungicides for her next potato crop.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying fertilizers

loans.name: Maebell

texts.en:
Maebel E., 23 years old is a young farmer in Veruela Agusan Del Sur. She said, when she got pregnat of her eldest child, her husband started tilling rice field to be able produce income to buy food, clothing and other needs.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use he loan to fund her farm and obtrain abundant harvest for her family.

She said that she likes the CEVI services because it has a avery low interest rate which is 2% a month.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita C., 43 years old is a mother of five children. She was married in 1988 which is two years after martial law in the Philippines. She has 2 separate rice field. Now, she has one farm that is having an on-going harvest. She started her farming business since 2009. 

She would like to grow her farm. She deeply needs additional capital to finance her farm. The loan will help a lot in renting farm equipment for land preparation and in paying the laborers who helped till the rice field.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Wendelyn

texts.en:
Wendelyn P., 45 years old, is a farmer who has four children. Her eldest child is 24 years old. Though she wanted to send her eldest child to college, their income is not enough to shoulder all the expenses. The tuition is very expensive.

She would like to expand her rice farm. She would like to avail a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her businessto and be able to obtain an abundant harvest for her family.

In April of 2009, she joined in CEVI. Because she likes the policies, she said she will continue to avail CEVI services as she develops her business.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Yeoun

texts.en: Yeoun S., age 26, is married and has two school-aged children. She lives with her husband in Battambong Province. To make a living, she and her husband manufacture rice wine and raise pigs at home. They typically earn collectively US $6 per day. S. has to work hard everyday to ensure a good living for her family and her two young children. Therefore, she is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more piglets that she can raise and then sell. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: piglet purchase.

loans.name: Mrs. Sothy Chheang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothy C. is a beautician. She is 29 years old and the mother of two children who are just 2 and 4 years old. Her husband, Mr. Sreng Chamroeun, is a construction worker. Now she is requesting a loan to buy some supplies for her beauty shop. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

Mrs. Sothy C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. This village bank loan includes sixteen people who all live in Slab Ta Aon village in Kandal province.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a beauty shop

loans.name: Xuan's Group

texts.en:
Xuân Thị Lê, born in 1969, lives in Xuan Trach, Xuan Canh, Dong Anh, Ha Noi. She lives with her parents-in-law, her husband, who is a builder, and her daughter, who is a worker. She has two children: her son is in the military. Xuân Thị Lê's main job is farming, but she raises pigs, too. In her free time, she looks for additional work. The family's monthly cumulative income is about 5,000 VND. Xuân Thị Lê is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA. She would like to obtain a loan in the amount of 4,142 VND to buy pig feed.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Vẻ Thị Nguyễn was born in 1957 and has two children. She would like to borrow 4,578 VND to use for her small business.

Luyến Thị Đào was born in 1966. She hopes to obtain a loan in the amount of 5,014 VND to buy goods to sell.

Đông Thị Nguyễn was born in 1974 and has two children. She has requested a loan in the amount of 5,014 VND to buy food for the domestic animals she raises.

Thủy Thị Lê was born in 1971. She makes rice paper and wishes to borrow 5,450 VND to buy rice.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica P. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Veronica is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Veronica owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting sugarcane for sale. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from this activity.

In 2009, Veronica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Veronica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Veronica is now requesting a second loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her sugarcane crops

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene S., 36 years old, is a rice grower. She has five children, the eldest is 18 years old. Currently, she is helping her husband till their one hectare farm. She hopes that their farm will provide her family with enough food, clothing and income to pay the school tuitions and other needs.

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her rice farm. The loan will hopefully help improve her yield to support the needs for her family.

loans.use: Farm financing.

loans.name: Khey

texts.en: Khey P., age 37, is married with five children. She lives with her husband in Battambong Province. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling bread and dessert (jelly), typically earning US $5 per day. Her husband is currently employed in a private supermarket a security guard, earning an income of US $3.33 per day. Both of them have to work hard everyday to ensure a good living for their family and her five children. Consequently, she is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more bread and vegetable to resell. With the remainders, she wants to repair her house. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: buy bread and vegetable

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Phuong T. N. was born in 1971. ( id: 010107070018). She lives in Xuan Trach, Xuan Canh, Dong Anh, Ha Noi. She has two children. They are small. Her husband is a builder and she is farmer. She raises pigs and grows rice. In her free time, she looks for work. She can do anything to earn money to raise her children. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. She loves amortized loans because it is consistent with the income of her family. This time, she wants to borrow 5.886.000 VND to buy food for pigs.
 About the other borrower in her group:
 Mai T. L. was born in 1954. ( id: 010107070020).  She has a child. She sells vegetabL. in the market. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to small business.

loans.use: buy food for pigs

loans.name: Rerika

texts.es:
Rerika tiene 25 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos en la casa de su suegra. Junto a su esposo, se dedica a la siembra de papa y arvejas, por ser éstos, productos muy rentables. Diariamente, desde las 8 de la mañana y hasta las 5 de la tarde trabaja en sus chacras, pero durante la época de cosecha necesita de más tiempo para transportar los sacos de su producto hasta su depósito, terminando a las 8 ó 9 de la noche. Posteriormente, los días miércoles, madruga para llevar sus productos al mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde los compradores están a la espera de los agricultores. Una vez que Rerika llega al mercado, indaga sobre los precios, para no aventurarse a vender muy bajo precio y obtener mayores ganancias.
Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, donde ha demostrado responsabilidad en sus cuotas y puntualidad en las reuniones de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su próxima siembra de papa.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es una mujer de 45 años de edad, vive es su casa propia, tenía 8 hijos, pero uno de ellos murió hace poco tiempo. Debido a esto y por la pena que la aquejaba, Victoria descuidó la alimentación de sus animales, pues su actividad cotidiana es la crianza de cerdos y vacas. Con el paso del tiempo ha ido recuperando su ánimo y ha volcado nuevamente sus fuerzas hacia sus animales. En el caso de los cerdos, los engordar durante 6 meses, y luego los comercializa en una carnicería de la ciudad. Por otro lado, durante la crianza de las vacas, aprovecha al máximo la leche, la cual recolecta y elabora deliciosos quesos que vende al por mayor a los comerciantes del mercado. Victoria ama sus actividades, ya que mediante ellas educó a todos sus hijos, mientras que su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, de ese modo, juntos cubren las necesidades de su hogar.
Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, ella se siente muy cómoda en su banco comunal y durante todo este tiempo no ha descuidado el pago de sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos balanceados para la alimentación de sus cerdos.
texts.en:
Victoria is 45 years old and lives in her own home. She has eight children, but one passed away recently. Victoria raises pigs and cattle, but while in mourning, she wasn't always able to feed and care for her animals. Fortunately, time has helped to lessen her grief and she has returned to her work. She fattens pigs for six months, then takes them to be sold at a butcher shop in the city. When one of her cows has been bred, Victoria gets as much from the milk as she can. She makes delicious cheeses and sells them wholesale to merchants. Victoria loves her work; it has allowed her to provide all her children with an education. Her husband is a farmer, and together they're able to provide their household with all the necessities. This is Victoria's fourth loan with MFP; she's very content with her community bank and has never neglected her payments. Your contribution will help Victoria to purchase feed for her pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying pig feed

loans.name: Taalaikul's Group

texts.en:
Taalaikul, the leader of this group, does not seem to be different from any other woman of her age. For her age of forty-six, she has accomplished her life minimum: got married, has lived her life in harmony by her taxi driver husband’s side, and has raised four children. Her children have grown, educated. One of her daughters works as a chemistry teacher. Another one goes to college. The little one is still in high school. After her children grew up, Taalaikul decided to engage herself in something new. She started working as a saleswoman at a silver store. After two years, she had saved enough money to invest in her own business. By that time she perceived all the nuances of this occupation. She had become a businesswoman. Now, she sells Indian silver that she buys at different places and, together with her husband, she conducts a survey implemented by international organizations. Her monthly income of $360 allows her to pay for her daughter’s education and to buy clothes for her little daughter. Recently she has even bought herself a set of jewelry. Taalaikul needs a loan to increase the turnover. She wants to purchase silver watches and bracelets. Her dream is to organize a chain of silver stores. 

Taalaikul has four partners. 
Mairambubu, 51, has raised four children. To make a living she sells milk and works as a seamstress in a sewing factory, sewing curtains. She needs a loan to buy a washing machine. 

Taalaikul J., 46, has three children. She works as a tailor, manufacturing traditional articles, bedding, rugs etc. Taalaikul urgently needs a loan to purchase curtains, velvet, dresses and other fabric and some furniture. She recently received an order from local municipality and school.

Jumagul, 61, sells foodstuffs and detergents at her little shop. Her monthly income is $166. She needs a loan to purchase cereals, canned food, beverages, and biscuits and to buy clothes for her grandchildren.

Taatykan, 56, is a widow. She has four children. For the past ten years she has been selling milk, gardening and farming. Taatykan needs a loan to purchase four sheep for breeding.
 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

loans.use: To increase the inventory by purchasing silver watches and bracelets.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina T., 39 years old is a rice farmer and a mother of seven children. Her eldest is 16 years old who are her inspiratation to do more to obtain sucees in her business. When she was younger she dreamed to graduate in college. Because they don't have money to finance her schooling, she never able to degree.

Now, she needs a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her business. The loan will go far in paying the laboptrers that toil hard for her farm. Hopefully, she will have a good return of all she invested in her business.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Toud

texts.en: Toud P., age 32, is married with four school-aged children. She lives with her husband in Battambong Province. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling groceries, typically earning US $6 per day. Her husband is involved in the agriculture sector of growing rice and fruit trees, earning an income of US $5.5 per day. Both of them have to work hard everyday to ensure a good living for their family and her four children. Consequently, she is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $1200 to purchase more plots of farmland to grow rice for more output to meet the current market’s requirement. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: buy plots of farmland

loans.name: Jacquelo

texts.en:
Jacquelo S. is from the village of Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 29 years old. Jacquelo is married and has 1 infant child. Jacquelo owns & operates a specialized seafood products retail store. Jacquelo has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jacquelo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Jacquelo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jacquelo is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP. She will purchase new items for her shop in order to expand the product offering. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jacquelo from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase new items and expand the seafood product offering.

loans.name: Mrs. Theavy Chem Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Theavy C. is a group leader of six members who all live in Prey Kduoch village in Takeo province. She is a rice middle woman. Her husband, Mr. Teng Thim, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because his field is infertile soil. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Theavy C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and she would use the rest of money to buy piglet for breeding. She is 34 years old and the mother of five children, four of whom are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. 

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and she would use the rest of money to buy piglet for breeding.

loans.name: Nadejda's Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group, Nadejda, is a forty-eight year old woman who has spent twenty years of her life keeping cows. As soon as she got married, she started raising a cow and found this occupation most suitable for herself. She even managed to convince her husband to be engaged in the same activity. Now, her husband as well, is occupied with breeding cows. He brings the cattle home and also milks them and helps his wife turn in the milk. They manage to daily turn in 32 liters of milk, which brings them $140 each month. This is not a big sum. Nevertheless, they have been able to buy convenience goods, a wall unit and to conduct periodic repair of their house. They have three children, who live with their own families. The children received a good upbringing from their parents, and started their married lives quite early. Nadejda has applied for this loan to buy hay for wintertime for her cows. She has a dream to have a car. But before purchasing a car, she is going to finish the repairs to her house and increase the total population of her livestock. 

These are Nadejda’s partners: Gulbaiyas, Raifa and Alexandra. 
Gulbaiyas, 46, is married and has two children. Her daughter goes to college and works as a saleswoman in a grocery store. Gulbaiyas’s husband is a driver. As for herself, she sells milk and works in the field. Gulbaiyas is in need of a loan for harvesting barley, corn and wheat. 

Raifa, 54, is divorced. She has one son, 28, who works as a shepherd. He also milks cows and sells milk. Raifa works as a controller, but she manages to save time to help her son milk cows and sell milk. She needs a loan to purchase hay for wintertime. 

Alexandra, 57, has one son. Her husband works as a metal worker and her son sells chewing gum, distributing them by his own car. Alexandra works as a mail carrier and she also keeps cows and sells milk. Therefore, she needs a loan to buy hay for wintertime.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy hay for wintertime for cows.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en: Noah S., age 37, is a widow. She lives with her two young children in Battambong Province. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling groceries, vegetable, typically earning US $6 per day. She is also involved in the agriculture sector as a rice field farmer when she is free from her business. S. has to work hard everyday to ensure a good living for her family and her two children. Therefore, she is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase more groceries and vegetable to expand her current business. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: buy groceries

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma S. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay Gingoog City. She is 39 years old. Alma is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. She sells both food & daily use products to local community members. Alma has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Alma is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product inventory. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Alma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan S. is a young farmer in Veruela Agusan Del Sur. Now, she is managing the family rice farm. She also have pigs which she hopes could provide her family enough income to buy food and other basic needs.

She would like to request a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the to fund her farm. Receiving a loan is truly helpful to pay for the equipment for land preparation and the ;aborers who helped toil the rice field.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Khan

texts.en: Khan C., age 26, is married and has a young child. She lives with her husband in Battambong Province. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling groceries in front of her house in the village, typically earning US $3 per day. Her husband is currently employed in a private company transporting dirt to refill the land, earning an income of US $4 per day. This couple has to work hard everyday to ensure a good living for the family and their child. Therefore, Khan is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $600 to purchase a motorbike to transport the goods she buys from the market to sell at her village. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to raise the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Mejara

texts.en:
Mejara C. is from the village of  Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay Gingoog city. She is 39 years old. Mejara is separated from her spouse and has 5 school-aged children. Mejara owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Mejara has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mejara joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Mejara is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to be used to purchase new items to expand her product inventory. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Mejara from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product inventory.

loans.name: Zaryl's Group

texts.en:
The leader of the group, Zaryl, is fifty-three years old. Her parents used to breed livestock and Zaryl, from her early childhood, was familiar with this occupation. When she grew up, she got married and decided to continue in this activity of breeding livestock. She inherited her family’s occupation. For twenty years, she has been making a living in animal husbandry, raising livestock and selling milk products. Her spouse has been working as a gardener. They have two children: a daughter, 27, works in a pharmacy and a son, 7. Recently, Zaryl and her husband have made repairs to their house, built a shed and increased the total population of their livestock. Considering their monthly income of just $50, these are big achievements made. All this has been possible due to their cattle, which is their main active, as it is for anybody living in a village. Zaryl, wants to obtain a loan to buy cement and sand for building a jerry building and garage. In a very short time they are going to harvest the crops. They hope that they will be able to finish building before harvesting starts. 

Zaryl’s partners are: Venera, Gulzina and Orosulbu. Venera, 24, is married and has two little children. Together with her husband, she raises livestock. In addition, Venera sells milk to local villagers. Venera needs a loan to purchase goods for sale. She wants to open a small shop by her house where she would sell food items.

Gulzina, 63, and her husband have brought up four daughters. All of their daughters are married and live separately. She and her husband are engaged in cattle breeding. This has been their main occupation for thirty years. Gulzina needs a loan to purchase coal for winter.

Orosulbu, 62, is mother to nine children. Except the youngest son, all of the other children have gotten married and live separately. Orosulbu prefers not to depend on her children and earns her livelihood by raising livestock and selling milk. Orosulbu needs a loan to buy a heifer for subsequent breeding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand for building a jerry building and garage.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace T., 21 years old, is a rice farmer from Veruela Agusan del Sur. She is helping her parents manage their small rice field, which the hope will give enough income to buy food, clothing and to provide for other basic needs.

She heard about CEVI in their town. She likes the 2% interest rate because, for her, it is very low and easy to repay. She would like to apply for aloan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm and to buy the farm necessities. By doing so, she believes she will be able to obtain an abundant harvest.

loans.use: Farm financing.

loans.name: Preoung

texts.en: Preoung P., age 36, is a widower. He lives with his two young children in Battambong Province. To make a living, He is engaged in a business of selling groceries in front his house, typically earning an income US $10 per day. P. has to work hard everyday to ensure a good living for his family and his two children. Therefore, he is seeking to increase his income and improve his business. He is asking for a loan of US $1100 to purchase a new motorbike as a means of transporting the goods he purchases from the markets in the town and to resell in this village. By doing so, he believes that he will be able to raise the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en: Ernesto C. is a 59-year-old father of five children. His children are already married and now only he and his wife work in the field for income.  Ernesto would like to request a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc.  He will use the loan to finance his farm and his efforts to produce an abundant harvest. Receiving this loan is truly worthwhile since he currently doesn't have the money himself to support the business.

loans.use: To finance his farm.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng S., age 35, is married with two children. He lives with his wife (pictured) in Battambong Province. To make a living, he and his wife sell groceries, typically earning $9 per day. Both of them have to work hard everyday to ensure a good living for their family. Therefore, S. is seeking to increase his income and improve his business. He is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase more groceries to expand his business. By doing so, he believes that he will be able to achieve a good standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her store.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza C. is from the village of Pandan in Gingoog City. She is 23 years old and married with two infant children.  Riza recently started a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells food and daily use products in the local community.  She joined HSPFI earlier this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Riza successfully repaid a loan of 5000 PHP which she used to expand her product offering.  Now she is requesting her second loan, for 8000 PHP, to purchase additional products to sell.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Um I. is 39 years old and sells wood wI. her husband in the Prey Veng province. Her business has been around for about four years and she makes a combine about US$2 of profit every day. Selling wood has been a difficult business, as the price of wood is higher than before. She is asking for a loan of US$800 to make two investments. She would like to both invest US$200 in her wood business, and also put US$600 to purchase a trailer and a motorbike to transport the wood. She sees these investments as opportunities that will be able to increase her daily income. (Um is pictured wI. her husband)

loans.use: To purchase a trailer and a motorbike.

loans.name: Beoun

texts.en: Beoun B., age 33, is married with a young child. He lives with his wife (pictured) in Battambong Province. To make a living, he provides transportation services to people in the town, typically earning $3 per day. His wife is involved in a business of selling groceries and fried meatballs at her house and other gathering places such as parks and markets, earning an income of $5 per day. Both of them have to work hard everyday to ensure a good living for their family. Therefore, B. is seeking to increase his income and improve his business. He is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike to transport meatballs to sell. Also he will operate a motor taxi to earn more income. By doing so, he believes that he will B. able to raise the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Mov

texts.en: Mov V., 42, sells yams with her husband in the local market of her Prey Veng province. She is married with four children, who two are construction workers; one is a student and one is too young to attend. She typically makes a combine about US$2 each day, and would like a loan to expand her business. In order to increase her profits, she is asking for US$ to purchase more yams to sell in the market.

loans.use: To purchase more yams.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam S., 37, works in a casino along the Vietnam and Cambodia borders. He is married and lives with his wife and three school-aged children. He typically makes about $6 per day and is his wife also helps support the family by selling porridge and noodle soup from their home in Phnom Penh. She earns around $24 in revenue per day. This couple would like to take out a loan of $1200 to reinvest in the porridge and noodle soup business.  Sam's wife is pictured here in front of the store.

loans.use: To invest in a porridge and noodle soup business.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna T. is from the village of San Juan, Gingoog City. She is 35 years old. Erna is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Erna owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for her business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Erna has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Erna is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in further expanding her business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Erna from HSPFI.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en: Marianita C. is a married woman, and has three children. She is a rice farmer. Harvest time is almost near but Marianita’s farm is still in need of additional farm inputs. She is a new member of CEVI. She is satisfied with its program. Now she applied for a loan of Php6, 000 in order for her to acquire the additional farm inputs that she needs.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Florida

texts.en: Florida D. is a rice farmer in the town of Magsaysay, Veruela, Agusan Del Sur.  Her rice field, which is her means of living, needs financing. A member of CEVI, she applied for a loan of Php6, 000. She will use the loan to finance her farm. She likes CEVI’s program especially the Insurance and Savings policy.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Lutchemie

texts.en:
Lutchemie L. has been married for four years and is the young mother of a 1-year-old child. She tills a rice field in her hometown.

Like her fellow farmers, Lutchemie aspires to a good and abundant harvest. She joined CEVI and immediately adapted to its policies and thinks the monthly meeting does not bring hassle to the farmers. She requested a loan of Php 6,000 which she will use for additional farm inputs. This loan will help her and her family to lighten their way of living.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe P. is 55 years of age and she and her husband of 30 years are blessed with one child.

Fe is a rice farmer in need of financial assistance. It is her first time joining a microfinance institution like CEVI. She hopes to have a good partnership with CEVI.

Fe applied for a loan of Php 6,000, which will be used to pay for farm inputs. Aside from the financial service she obtained, Fe will be able to save because of CEVI’s low interest rate.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Erlene

texts.en:
Arlene N., 49 years old mother of eight children. Her eldest child is just 22 years old. Though she wanted to send her child to college, their income is not enough to shoulder everyting like books and tuition fees because they are very expensive. 

She would like to request for aloan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventutes Inc. She will use the loan to buy farmong needs and pay the rental for the equipment that she borrowed during land preparation.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Elas

texts.en:
Elas T. is from the village of Agong-ong, Gingoog City. She is 37 years old. Elas is married and has 4 school-aged children.

To make a living, Elas owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Elas has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elas joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elas has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to pay for services to increase crop yield. Elas is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business.

This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elas from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia D. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis, Occidental. She is 52-years-old. Cornelia is married and has one school-age child. Cornelia owns and operates a "tuba" retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products in the local community. Cornelia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cornelia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cornelia is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cornelia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila M., 32 years old  is a rice farmerin Veruela Agusan del Sur. All her life was spent in the farm. Her parents are farmers so when she got married, planting rice and harvesting the grains are not a difficult subject for her. 

she would like to ask a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her rice farm to be able to obtain abundant harvest. Receiving this loan is truly worthwhile since she doesn't have monet now to support her business. 

She is a new CEVI client and she started to like the program.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina O., 50 years old, is a rice farmer from Veruela Agusan Del Sur. She has one child who is 18 years old already. She has had a business since 1990 until now. She keeps doing her best to susutain the family livelihood.

Currently she needs additional capital to fund her 1 hectare farm. She would like to request a loan of 6,000 PHP from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy farming necessities and improve her yield.

The income she makes from her farm has been very helpful in paying for school and basic needs in their home.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie E. is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis, Occidental. She is 32-years-old. Virgie is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Virgie owns and operates a "sari-sari" general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Virgie has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Virgie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Virgie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Virgie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ronette

texts.en: Ronette B. is from the village of P-3, Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 25 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Ronette owns and operates a specialized retail business selling a variety of viands like "litson" (whole roasted pig) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years. In 2009, Ronette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en: Enriquita L. is from the town of Katipunan. She is 49 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Enriquita owns and operates a business running a food stall, selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Enriquita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Enriquita is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital for the business. A portion of the loan will be used to purchase construction materials for house repair. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and provide a comfortable shelter in which to live. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira M. is 55 years old and a married mother of four grown up children. She lives in Tudor, Mombasa with her husband Islam Said. 

Munira runs a cargo clearing and forwarding business in Mombasa and her office is situated in Mombasa's central business district. She has been in that business for 20 years and has been able to acquire many clients who need their cargo cleared and forwarded. 

This will be Munira's first loan from KADET and she plans to invest the money as working capital to facilitate the processes with other organizations involved in the business.

She hopes to become a leader in clearing and forwarding business. 


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Investing in her cargo clearing and forwarding business in Mombasa.

loans.name: Necifora

texts.en:
Necifora R., from the village of P-2, Brgy. 25, Pandan City, is 49 years old, married, and the mother of three school-aged children. To make a living, Necifora owns and operates a tailoring business whose main income comes from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Necifora has been engaged in her business for over three years, earning approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In April 2009, Necifora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials, Necifora is now requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her second from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs her family, most especially the children's education.

About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City, Mis. Or.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah K. is 28 years old. He is married to Magdaline Ndanu who is 22 years old and they are blessed with one child. Jeremiah has a retail stand in Changamwe where he sells an assortment of bags. He has been running this business for six years. Jeremiah was introduced to KADET by an existing client and is glad to access his first loan. He plans to increase the stock of bags in his store with the funds. He hopes that through subsequent loans from KADET he will be able to establish a permanent large store and to also diversify his business to clothing. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To increase his stock of bags

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim S., 36, is a true entrepreneur who sells rice, food and grocery items from home. She makes US$48 in revenue each day in Phnom Penh.

Kim is married and has one child living at home to support. Her husband, Oum Sophat, grows and sells vegetables. He makes approximately US$5 every day.

Kim would like a loan of US$1,000 to expand her businesses. She will increase her grocery inventory and also reinvest in her food business.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Mutua

texts.en:
Mutua N. is a 27 year old married father of one child called Fundi Nicholas who is seven months. His wife Esther Mawia is 25 years old and the family lives in Mshomori in Mombasa.

Mutua is in the business of selling second hand shoes in the busy Kongowea market and has been in operation for five years. 

He has never accessed any loan from a lending organization and with this first borrowing from KADET he plans to purchase second hand bails of clothes in an effort to diversify his shoe selling business.

He hopes to open a bigger store in future in order to maximize on his income.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Purchasing second hand clothes bails.

loans.name: Mwachiti

texts.en:
Mwachiti C., a 31-year-old father of three children, is married to Nelly Kalume, a businesswoman, and they live in Likoni Mombasa. A businessman dealing in second-hand clothes in the Kongowea market in Mombasa, Mwachiti has run his enterprise for three years now and business is good.

He has never received any funding for his business from any source, and the loan he is requesting from KADET will be used to purchase more bales of second-hand clothes. In the future Mwachiti hopes to establish a major wholesale store supplying both bedding and clothing.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Purchasing second hand clothes bales.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex Kimani, a 37-year-old father of one child, is married to Lily Njeri, who is a house wife. The family lives in Kongowea, Mombasa. For eight years Alex has run a leather work shop in Kongowea, a location that has enabled him gain many customers due to the busy Kongowea market.

He learned of KADET during a marketing exercise and he is now accessing his first loan, which he plans to invest by purchasing shoe-making materials, thus diversifying his business. His future hopes are to expand his business and become a major supplier of shoes and leather materials.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Purchasing shoe-making tools.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas S. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Phnom Penh. She has been selling meat balls, duck eggs and fry frogs since 2007 to earn a living, and is able to make about US$5 of profit every day. Her husband, Vong Sarann, 43, is a driver. He makes approximately US$5 as well. Meas Sophari would like to take out a loan of US$1200 to make a new investment. Meas wants to sell clothes to have additional profit to raise the standard of living.

loans.use: Sell clothes.

loans.name: Cosmus

texts.en:
Cosmus N. is 33 years old and married to Irene Mbete who is a businesslady in Changamwe. The couple has been blest with three children Angela, Michael and Flora who are all students. 

Cosmus runs a hotel in Changamwe that has been in operation for six years where he has been able to satisfy many customers many who are residents who work near his hotel.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend and is now accessing his first borrowing. He plans to purchase different foodstuffs and to also do some renovations in his hotel in order to retain and even attract more customers.

Cosmus hopes to start selling cereals and also intends to start selling water in the area. By doing so he says he will be able to offer more service to the locals while maximizing on his income.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs and to do some renovations in his hotel.

texts.en:
Michelle K. is from the village of P-4, Brgy. 25, Pandan, Gingoog City.  She is 27 years old. Michelle is single and has four school-age children. To make a living, Michelle owns and operates a retail clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing general clothing services to local community members with her "ukay-ukay" store. Michelle has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Michelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michelle is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and also for working capital.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Seang R., 51, is married and lives with four of her children in the Phnom Penh. To earn a living, she has been selling food and beverages from home. She typically makes about US$15 per day, while her husband works in Ministry of land, making US$1.5 a day. One of the children is a construction worker and makes US$5 every day. Seang R. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to reinvest in her businesses. She will purchase more chairs and tables.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs and tables.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 33 years old. He lives in Barangay Larion, Bajo, Tuguegarao City. He is a hardworking man who is engaged in the buy and sell business.  Aside from that, he is also helping his wife in managing their mini grocery store. He usually sell his products in Tuguegarao City and sometimes in other towns.  The couple is helping one another to be able to generate bigger income for the future of their family especially in supporting the education of their children.

Richard patiently maintains his small enterprise to achieve his goal and uplift their way of living.  For this reason, Richard is asking a financial help from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP30, 000 that will be utilized as additional business capital to his computer shop and buy and sell business. Moreover, Richard is also grateful for the opportunity of helping his parents with their daily basic needs through his generated income from his business. Richard is also hoping to become successful in his business endeavor so that somehow, he could give his family a comfortable living.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Esperideon

texts.en:
Esperideon M. is from the village of Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis, Occidental. He is 53-years-old. Esperideon is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Esperideon owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. Esperideon has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Esperideon joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esperideon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional animals. Esperideon is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Esperideon from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe C. is a retailer in the village of Barangcuag Angadana, Isabela. She is already 29 years of age, married to Joselito C. who is working in a certain construction site near their place. They are already blessed with a child and he is now in his third year high school. They are 3 family members living peacefully in their village of Barangcuag of which it is a rural and plain area, along the town highway.
Her store is doing well though it was just started over the past two months. She is asking for additional business capital in order to further improve the business and earn a bigger income for her family. Weekly, Fe is able to earn around PHP2, 500 gross income, the income is being revolved for the maintenance of the business while some of which is being used as daily allowances of her child in school. She hopes to avail the amount of PHP5, 000 as added capital to her general store business development

loans.use: additional business capital

To make a living, Eliezer owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Eliezer is just starting this business.

In 2007, Eliezer joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eliezer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,500 PHP from PMPC. Eliezer is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Eliezer from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en: Natalya is divorced and has two adult children. She owns a small store and sells food and groceries. The income is about 3,500 UAH per month. This business is the only source of income for Natalya. Her goal is to make enough money to provide for herself and help her children. So, Natalya wants to develop this business further and increase the sales. Natalya would like to borrow 6,500 UAH to purchase more inventories. She is very enthusiastic person and desires to move forward in her business as well as in her life.

loans.name: Heidi Joy
